chapter: Chapter 47 | Reward of combing one’s beard seventy times
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی الْحُسَیْنُ بْنُ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِیَادٍ عَنْ إِبْرَاهِیمَ بْنِ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ الْحَجَّاجِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عُمَرَ الْهَمْدَانِیِّ عَنِ ابْنِ عَطِیَّهَ عَنْ إِسْمَاعِیلَ بْنِ جَابِرٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ قَالَ: مَنْ سَرَّحَ لِحْیَتَهُ سَبْعِینَ مَرَّهً وَ عَدَّهَا مَرَّهً مَرَّهً لَمْ یَقْرَبْهُ الشَّیْطَانُ أَرْبَعِینَ صَبَاحاً.
hadees_english: 1. It was narrated to me by al-Hussain b. Ahmad from Sahl b. Ziyad from Ibrahim b. Abdulrahman b. al-Hajjaj from Muhammad b. Umar al-Hamadani from Ibn ’Atiyyah from Ismail b. Jabir from Abi Abdillah who said who said: “Shaitaan will remain aloof for next forty days from one who combs his beard seventy times.”

chapter: Chapter 48 | Reward of applying Antimony (Surma)
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی سَعْدُ بْنُ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ یَعْقُوبَ بْنِ یَزِیدَ عَنِ الْحُسَیْنِ بْنِ عَلِیِّ بْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ عَلِیِّ بْنِ عُقْبَهَ عَنْ یُونُسَ بْنِ یَعْقُوبَ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: الْإِثْمِدُ یَجْلُو الْبَصَرَ وَ یَقْطَعُ الدَّمْعَهَ وَ یُنْبِتُ الشَّعْرَ.
hadees_english: 1. My father said: it was narrated to me by Sa’d b. Abdillah from Ya’qub b. Yazid from al-Hussain b. Ali b. Fadhal from Ali b. ’Uqba from Yunis b. Ya’qub from some of our companions from Abi Abdillah who said: “Surma improves eyesight, stops tears and helps hair growth.”

hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی أَحْمَدُ بْنُ عَلِیٍّ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ عَلِیِّ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ مُقَاتِلٍ عَنْ أَبِی الْحَسَنِ الرِّضَا ع قَالَ: مَنْ کانَ یُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَ الْیَوْمِ الْآخِرِ فَلْیَکْتَحِلْ.
hadees_english: 2. It was narrated to me by Ahmad b. Ali from his father from Ali b. Muhammad from Abdillah b. Muqatil from Abi al-Hassan al-Ridha who said: “A person who has faith on Allah and the Day of Judgment would surely apply Antimony.”

hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ مُوسَی بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ عَنْ مُوسَی بْنِ عَمِیرَهَ عَنْ حَمْزَهَ بْنِ بَزِیعٍ عَنْ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ عَامِرٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: الْکُحْلُ عِنْدَ النَّوْمِ أَمَانٌ مِنَ الْمَاءِ.
hadees_english: 3. It was narrated to me by Ahmad b. Muhammad from his father from Muhammad b. Ahmad from Musa b. Ja’far from Musa b. ’Umayra from Hamzah b. Bazee’ from Ishaq b. ’Amir from Abi Abdillah who said: “Applying Antimony before going to bed stops watering of the eyes.”

chapter: Chapter 48 | Reward of applying Antimony (Surma)
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی الْحَسَنُ بْنُ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِیَادٍ عَنِ ابْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عُثْمَانَ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: الْکُحْلُ یُنْبِتُ الشَّعْرَ وَ یُجَفِّفُ الدَّمْعَهَ وَ یُعْذِبُ الرِّیقَ وَ یَجْلُو الْبَصَرَ.
hadees_english: 4. It was narrated to me by al-Hassan b. Ahmad from his father from Muhammad b. Ahmad from Sahl b. Ziyad from Ibn Sinan from Hamad b. Uthman from Abi Abdillah who said: “Applying Antimony helps hair growth, tears dry up, spit thickens and eyesight improves.”

chapter: Chapter 49 | Reward of cutting one’s hair
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ الصَّفَّارُ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحُسَیْنِ بْنِ سَعِیدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِی عَمِیرَهَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِی حَمْزَهَ عَنْ إِسْحَاقَ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع اسْتَأْصِلْ شَعْرَکَ تَقِلَّ دَوَابُّهُ وَ دَرَنُهُ وَ وَسَخُهُ وَ تَغْلُظْ رَقَبَتُکَ وَ یَجْلُو بَصَرَکَ.
hadees_english: 1. The narrator says that Imam Ja’far Sadiq said to him, “Cut your hair so that dandruff and lice gets reduced. Cutting hair broadens one’s neck and improves eyesight.”

chapter: Chapter 50 | Reward of trimming one’s nails and moustache
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی عَلِیُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِیمَ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ زَیْدٍ عَنِ السَّکُونِیِّ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ص مَنْ قَلَّمَ أَظْفَارَهُ یَوْمَ الْجُمُعَهِ أَخْرَجَ اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ مِنْ أَنَامِلِهِ الدَّاءَ وَ أَدْخَلَ فِیهَا الدَّوَاءَ.
hadees_english: 1. It is narrated by Imam Ja’far Sadiq from his predecessors that the Messenger of Allah (s.a.w.s.) said, “For one who trims his nails on Friday the Almighty Allah would remove pain from his fingers and insert medicine to them.”

hadees_arabic: وَ بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ص مَنْ قَلَّمَ أَظْفَارَهُ یَوْمَ السَّبْتِ أَوْ یَوْمَ الْخَمِیسِ وَ أَخَذَ مِنْ شَارِبِهِ عُوفِیَ مِنْ وَجَعِ الْأَضْرَاسِ وَ وَجَعِ الْعَیْنِ.
hadees_english: 2. The Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) says, “One who trims his nails and moustache on Thursday or Saturday will remain safe from the pain of teeth and eyes.”

hadees_english: 3. Imam Ja’far Sadiq says, “One who trims all his nails except one on Thursday and trims the remaining one on Friday, Allah would remove his poverty.”

hadees_english: 4. It is narrated by Imam Ja’far Sadiq from his predecessors that the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) said, “Trimming nails prevents serious hardships and increases one’s earnings.”

hadees_arabic: وَ بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِیسَی عَنْ أَبِی أَیُّوبَ الْمَدَائِنِیِّ عَنْ أَبِی عَمِیرَهَ عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ سَالِمٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: تَقْلِیمُ الْأَظْفَارِ یَوْمَ الْجُمُعَهِ یُؤْمِنُ مِنَ الْجُذَامِ وَ الْبَرَصِ وَ الْعَمَی فَإِنْ لَمْ تَحْتَجْ فَحُکَّهَا حَکّاً.
hadees_english: 5. And from the previous chain from Muhammad b. Isa from Abi Ayoob’ al-Madaini from Abi ’Umayra from Hisham b. Salim from Abi Abdillah who said: “Trimming nails on Friday saves one from leprosy, leucoderma and blindness. If it is not possible to trim them, one should at least rub them on something.”

chapter: Chapter 50 | Reward of trimming one’s nails and moustache
hadees_arabic: وَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع مَنْ قَلَّمَ أَظْفَارَهُ وَ قَصَّ شَارِبَهُ فِی کُلِّ جُمُعَهٍ- ثُمَّ قَالَ بِسْمِ اللَّهِ وَ بِاللَّهِ وَ عَلَی مِلَّهِ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ ص أُعْطِیَ بِکُلِّ قُلَامَهٍ عِتْقَ رَقَبَهٍ مِنْ وُلْدِ إِسْمَاعِیلَ.
hadees_english: 6. Imam Ja’far Sadiq says, “One who recites Bismillaahi wa billaahi wa a’laa millaati rasoolillaah while trimming nails and moustache on Friday would get the reward of freeing a slave from the progeny of Ismail for each hair and nail trimmed.”

chapter: Chapter 50 | Reward of trimming one’s nails and moustache
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی سَعْدُ بْنُ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ صَالِحِ بْنِ عُقْبَهَ عَنْ أَبِی کَهْمَسٍ قَالَ: قُلْتُ لِأَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع عَلِّمْنِی دُعَاءً أَسْتَنْزِلُ بِهِ الرِّزْقَ فَقَالَ لِی خُذْ مِنْ شَارِبِکَ وَ أَظْفَارِکَ وَ لْیَکُنْ ذَلِکَ فِی یَوْمِ الْجُمُعَهِ. قال محمد بن علی مؤلف هذا الکتاب قال أبی رض فی وصیه إلی قلم أظفارک و خذ من شاربک و ابدأ بخنصرک من یدک الیمنی و قل حین ترید تقلمها أو جز شاربک بسم الله و بالله و علی مله رسول الله ص فإنه من فعل ذلک کتب الله له بکل قلامه و جزازه عتق نسمه و لم یمرض إلا مرضه الذی یموت فیه.
hadees_english: 7. It was narrated to me by Muhammad b. al-Hassan who said it was narrated to me by Sa’d b. Abdillah from Muhammad b. al-Hassan from Salih b. ’Uqba from Abi Kahmas who said: “One of the advices of my father, may Allah’s peace be upon him, was: ‘O son! Trim your nails and moustache. Start trimming nails from the small finger of right hand and whenever you do the above two deeds, recite this supplication Bismillaahi wa billaahi wa a’laa millati rasoolillaah. O son! To one who performs this deed Allah would grant the reward of releasing a slave for each nail and hair trimmed and he will not be involved in any disease except death.”

chapter: Chapter 51 | Reward of wearing white shoes
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ یَحْیَی الْعَطَّارُ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَحْمَدَ عَنِ السَّیَّارِیِّ عَنْ أَبِی سُلَیْمَانَ الْخَوَّاصِ عَنْ أَبِی نُعَیْمٍ الْفَضْلِ بْنِ دُکَیْنٍ عَنْ سَدِیرٍ الصَّیْرَفِیِّ قَالَ: دَخَلْتُ عَلَی أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع وَ عَلَیَّ نَعْلٌ بَیْضَاءُ فَقَالَ یَا سَدِیرُ مَا هَذِهِ النَّعْلُ أَخَذْتَهَا عَلَی عِلْمٍ فَقُلْتُ لَا وَ اللَّهِ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاکَ فَقَالَ مَنْ دَخَلَ السُّوقَ قَاصِداً لِشِرَاءِ نَعْلٍ بَیْضَاءَ لَمْ یُبْلِهَا حَتَّی یَکْتَسِبَ مَالًا مِنْ حَیْثُ لا یَحْتَسِبُ قَالَ وَ أَخْبَرَنِی أَبُو نُعَیْمٍ أَنَّ سَدِیراً أَخْبَرَ أَنَّهُ لَمْ یُبْلِ تِلْکَ النَّعْلَ حَتَّی اکْتَسَبَ مِائَهَ دِینَارٍ مِنْ حَیْثُ لَمْ یَحْتَسِبْ.
hadees_english: 1. It was narrated to me by Muhammad b. al-Hassan who said it was narrated to me by Muhammad b. Yahya al-’Attar who said it was narrated to me by Muhammad b. Ahmad from al-Sayyari from Abi Sulayman al-Khawwadh from Abi Na’im al-Fadhl b. Dukayn from Sadeer al-Sayrafi who said: “One who goes to market with an intention of buying white shoes and buys them; then before those shoes are worn out, that person gets such a wealth, which he would have never expected.” Abu Naeem says that Sudair informed him saying, “My shoes were not worn out yet and I received a hundred dirhams from somewhere I had never expected.”

chapter: Chapter 52 | Reward of wearing yellow shoes
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ یَحْیَی عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ مُوسَی بْنِ عُمَیْرٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ جَبَلَهَ عَنْ حَنَانِ بْنِ سَدِیرٍ قَالَ: دَخَلْتُ عَلَی أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع وَ عَلَیَّ نَعْلٌ سَوْدَاءُ فَقَالَ مَا لَکَ وَ لُبْسَ نَعْلٍ سَوْدَاءَ أَ مَا عَلِمْتَ أَنَ فِیهَا ثَلَاثَ خِصَالٍ قَالَ قُلْتُ وَ مَا هِیَ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاکَ فَقَالَ تُضَعِّفُ الْبَصَرَ وَ تُرْخِی الذَّکَرَ وَ تُورِثُ الْهَمَّ وَ هِیَ مَعَ ذَلِکَ لِبَاسُ الْجَبَّارِینَ عَلَیْکَ بِلُبْسِ النَّعْلِ الصَّفْرَاءِ فَإِنَّ فِیهَا ثَلَاثَ خِصَالٍ قَالَ قُلْتُ وَ مَا هِیَ قَالَ تَحُدُّ الْبَصَرَ وَ تَشُدُّ الذَّکَرَ وَ تَنْفِی الْهَمَّ وَ هِیَ مَعَ ذَلِکَ لِبَاسُ الْأَنْبِیَاءِ.
hadees_english: 1. My father said: it was narrated to me by Muhammad b. Yahya from Muhammad b. Ahmad from Musa b. ’Umayr from Abdillah b. Jabalah from Hanan b. Sadeer who said: “Why are you wearing black shoes? Do you know its bad consequences?” He asked, “What are its bad effects?” Imam replied, “It affects eyesight and male prowess and it is a cause of sadness and anger. Further, it is the sign of oppressors. Wear yellow shoes and enjoy its benefits.” He asked, “What are the benefits of wearing them?” Imam replied, “It improves eyesight and increases male prowess. It ends sadness and anger and it is a part of the dress of the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.).”

chapter: Chapter 53 | Reward of wearing shoes
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی أَحْمَدُ بْنُ إِدْرِیسَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَیْنِ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ جَبَلَهَ عَنْ أَبِی الْجَارُودِ عَنْ أَبِی جَعْفَرٍ ع قَالَ: لُبْسُ الْخُفِّ یَزِیدُ فِی قُوَّهِ الْبَصَرِ.
hadees_english: 1. It was narrated to me by Muhammad b. al-Hassan who said it was narrated to me by Ahmad b. Idris from Muhammad b. al-Hussain from Abdillah b. Jabalah from Abi al-Jarud from Abi Ja’far who said: “Wearing shoes improves eyesight.”

chapter: Chapter 53 | Reward of wearing shoes
hadees_arabic: وَ بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ مُوسَی بْنِ عِمْرَانَ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ مُعَاوِیَهَ بْنِ وَهْبٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: إِدْمَانُ لُبْسِ الْخُفِّ أَمَانٌ مِنَ الْجُذَامِ قَالَ قُلْتُ فِی الشِّتَاءِ أَمْ فِی الصَّیْفِ قَالَ شِتَاءً کَانَ أَوْ صَیْفاً.
hadees_english: 2. And from the previous chain from Muhammad b. Ahmad from Musa b. ’Imran from Ibn Mahbub from Muawiyah b. Wahab from Abi Abdillah who said: “A person who wears shoes often does not get involved in leprosy.” The narrator asked, “Are you talking about summer or winter?” Imam replied, “There is no difference between them.”

chapter: Chapter 54 | Reward of reciting Surah Qadr while cutting a cloth for new dress
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَیْنِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عُمَرَ السَّرَّادِ عَمَّنْ أَخْبَرَهُ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَطَعَ ثَوْباً جَدِیداً وَ قَرَأَ إِنَّا أَنْزَلْناهُ فِی لَیْلَهِ الْقَدْرِ سِتّاً وَ ثَلَاثِینَ مَرَّهً فَإِذَا بَلَغَ تَنَزَّلُ الْمَلائِکَهُ أَخْرَجَ شَیْئاً مِنَ الْمَاءِ وَ رَشَّ عَلَی الثَّوْبِ رَشّاً خَفِیفاً ثُمَّ صَلَّی رَکْعَتَیْنِ وَ دَعَا رَبَّهُ وَ قَالَ فِی دُعَائِهِ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِی رَزَقَنِی مَا أَتَجَمَّلُ بِهِ فِی النَّاسِ وَ أُوَارِی بِهِ عَوْرَتِی وَ أُصَلِّی فِیهِ لِرَبِّی وَ حَمِدَ اللَّهَ لَمْ یَزَلْ یَأْکُلُ فِی سَعَهٍ حَتَّی یَبْلَی ذَلِکَ الثَّوْبُ.
hadees_english: 1. It was narrated to me by Ahmad b. Muhammad from his father from Muhammad b. Ahmad from Muhammad b. al-Hussain from Muhammad b. Umar al-Sarad from the one that narrated to him from Abi Abdillah who said: “A person should recite Surah Qadr thirty-six times while cutting a new cloth. When he reaches Tanazzalul malaa-ikatu, he should sprinkle a little water on the cloth. He should then offer a two rakat Salaat and recite this supplication Alh’amdulillaahilladhee razaqanee maa atajammalu bihi finnaasi wa uwaaree bihi a’uratee wa us’allee feehi lirabbee wa ah’madullaah. Before this cloth gets old, there would be abundance in livelihood.”

chapter: Chapter 55 | Reward of praising Allah much while looking in the mirror
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ عَنْ هَارُونَ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ مَسْعَدَهَ بْنِ صَدَقَهَ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ آبَائِهِ ع أَنَّ النَّبِیَّ ص قَالَ: إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ أَوْجَبَ الْجَنَّهَ لِشَابٍّ کَانَ یُکْثِرُ النَّظَرَ فِی الْمِرْآهِ فَیُکْثِرُ حَمْدَ اللَّهِ عَلَی ذَلِکَ.
hadees_english: 1. My father said: it was narrated to me by Abdillah b. Ja’far from Harun b. Muslim from Mas’ada b. Sadaqah from Ja’far b. Muhammad from his forefathers that The Prophet (s.a.w.s.) who said: “The Almighty Allah has decreed Paradise for those youths who look at the mirror and praise Allah much.”

chapter: Chapter 56 | Reward of reciting the following supplication upon seeing a Jew, Christian or a Magian
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ عَنْ هَارُونَ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ مَسْعَدَهَ بْنِ صَدَقَهَ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ آبَائِهِ ع أَنَّ النَّبِیَّ ص قَالَ: مَنْ رَأَی یَهُودِیّاً أَوْ نَصْرَانِیّاً أَوْ مَجُوسِیّاً أَوْ وَاحِداً عَلَی غَیْرِ مِلَّهِ الْإِسْلَامِ فَقَالَ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِی فَضَّلَنِی عَلَیْکَ بِالْإِسْلَامِ دِیناً وَ بِالْقُرْآنِ کِتَاباً وَ بِمُحَمَّدٍ نَبِیّاً وَ بِعَلِیٍّ إِمَاماً وَ بِالْمُؤْمِنِینَ إِخْوَاناً وَ بِالْکَعْبَهِ قِبْلَهً لَمْ یَجْمَعِ اللَّهُ بَیْنَهُ وَ بَیْنَهُ فِی النَّارِ أَبَداً.
hadees_english: 1. My father said: it was narrated to me by Abdillah b. Ja’far from Harun b. Muslim from Mas’ada b. Sadaqah from Ja’far b. Muhammad from his father from his forefathers that The Prophet (s.a.w.s.) who said: “One who recites Alh’amdulillaahilladhee faz”z”alnee a’laika bil islaami deenanw wa bi qur-aani kitaabanw wa bimuh’ammadin nabeeyanw wa bi-a’liyyin imaamanw wa bil mu-mineena ikhwaananw wabil ka’bati qiblah Allah won’t gather that person along with those people.”

chapter: Chapter 57 | Reward of complete ablution, Umrah, payment of Zakat…
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ یَحْیَی الْعَطَّارُ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی الْعَمْرَکِیُّ عَنِ الْبُوفَکِیِّ عَنْ عَلِیِّ بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ عَنْ أَخِیهِ مُوسَی بْنِ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ ع قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ص مَنْ أَسْبَغَ وُضُوءَهُ وَ أَحْسَنَ صَلَاتَهُ وَ أَدَّی زَکَاهَ مَالِهِ وَ کَفَّ غَضَبَهُ وَ سَجَنَ لِسَانَهُ وَ اسْتَغْفَرَ لِذَنْبِهِ وَ أَدَّی النَّصِیحَهَ لِأَهْلِ بَیْتِ نَبِیِّهِ ص فَقَدِ اسْتَکْمَلَ حَقَائِقَ الْإِیمَانِ وَ أَبْوَابُ الْجَنَّهِ مَفْتُوحَهٌ لَهُ.
hadees_english: 1. Imam Musa Kadhim narrates from his father, Imam Ja’far Sadiq that the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) said, “One who performs complete ablution, offers Salaat regularly, pays Zakat of his wealth regularly, controls his anger and tongue, repents for his sins and seeks goodness of the Ahle Bayt of the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) then all the duties of his faith are fulfilled and the doors of Paradise would be opened for him.”

chapter: Chapter 58 | Reward of reciting Raz”eetubillaahi rabbanw…
hadees_arabic: وَ بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ص مَنْ قَالَ رَضِیتُ بِاللَّهِ رَبّاً وَ بِالْإِسْلَامِ دِیناً وَ بِمُحَمَّدٍ رَسُولًا وَ بِأَهْلِ بَیْتِهِ أَوْلِیَاءَ کَانَ حَقّاً عَلَی اللَّهِ أَنْ یُرْضِیَهُ یَوْمَ الْقِیَامَهِ.
hadees_english: 1. The Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) says, “One who recites Raz”eetubillaahi rabbanw wa bil islaami deenanw wa bimuh’ammadir rasoolanw wa bi-ahli baytihi awliyaa – he has right that Allah becomes pleased with him on the Day of Judgment.”

chapter: Chapter 59 | Reward of supplicating day and night
hadees_arabic: وَ بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ قَالَ: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ص أَ لَا أَدُلُّکُمْ عَلَی سِلَاحٍ یُنْجِیکُمْ عَنْ عَدُوِّکُمْ وَ یُدِرُّ رِزْقَکُمْ قَالُوا نَعَمْ قَالَ تَدْعُونَ بِاللَّیْلِ وَ النَّهَارِ فَإِنَّ سِلَاحَ الْمُؤْمِنِ الدُّعَاءُ.
hadees_english: 1. And from the previous chain who said: “Supplicate day and night; for supplication is the weapon of a believer.”

chapter: Chapter 60 | Reward of going to a mosque
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ الصَّفَّارُ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَیْنِ بْنِ أَبِی الْخَطَّابِ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ بْنِ یَحْیَی عَنْ کُلَیْبٍ الصَّیْدَاوِیِّ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَکْتُوبٌ فِی التَّوْرَاهِ أَنَّ بُیُوتِی فِی الْأَرْضِ الْمَسَاجِدُ فَطُوبَی لِعَبْدٍ تَطَهَّرَ فِی بَیْتِهِ ثُمَّ زَارَنِی فِی بَیْتِی أَلَا إِنَّ عَلَی الْمَزُورِ کَرَامَهَ الزَّائِرِ وَ فِی حَدِیثٍ آخَرَ أَلَا بَشِّرِ الْمَشَّاءِینَ فِی الظُّلُمَاتِ إِلَی الْمَسَاجِدِ بِالنُّورِ السَّاطِعِ یَوْمَ الْقِیَامَهِ.
hadees_english: 1. It was narrated to me by Muhammad b. al-Hassan who said it was narrated to me by Muhammad b. al-Hassan al-Saffar from Muhammad b. al-Hussain b. Abi al-Khattab from Safwan b. Yahya from Kulayb al-Saydawi from Abi Abdillah who said: “Know that those who visit mosque in darkness will get bright eyesight and glad-tidings on the Day of Judgment.”

chapter: Chapter 61 | Reward of visiting mosque often
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی سَعْدُ بْنُ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ یَعْقُوبَ بْنِ یَزِیدَ عَنْ أَبِی عُمَیْرٍ عَنْ إِبْرَاهِیمَ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْحَمِیدِ عَنْ سَعْدٍ الْإِسْکَافِیِّ عَنْ زِیَادِ بْنِ عِیسَی عَنْ أَبِی الْجَارُودِ عَنِ الْأَصْبَغِ بْنِ نُبَاتَهَ عَنْ عَلِیِّ بْنِ أَبِی طَالِبٍ ع قَالَ کَانَ یَقُولُ مَنِ اخْتَلَفَ إِلَی الْمَسَاجِدِ أَصَابَ إِحْدَی الثَّمَانِ أَخاً مُسْتَفَاداً فِی اللَّهِ أَوْ عِلْماً مُسْتَطْرَفاً أَوْ آیَهً مُحْکَمَهً أَوْ رَحْمَهً مُنْتَظَرَهً أَوْ کَلِمَهً تَرْدَعُهُ عَنْ رَدًی أَوْ یَسْمَعُ کَلِمَهً تَدُلُّهُ عَلَی هُدًی أَوْ یَتْرُکُ ذَنْباً خَشْیَهً أَوْ حَیَاءً.
hadees_english: 1. Amirul Momineen says, “Those who visit mosque often would get the benefit of (at least) one of these eight things – benefiting from a brother in the way of Allah or gaining extra knowledge, or appearance of a strong sign, gaining that mercy which was awaited, benefiting from conversation which saves one from destruction, or hearing about an act of guidance, or keeping away from sins out of fear or keeping away from sins out of shame.”

chapter: Chapter 62 | Reward of going to a mosque on foot
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عَلِیِّ بْنِ مَاجِیلَوَیْهِ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ یَحْیَی الْعَطَّارُ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ یَعْلَی بْنِ حَمْزَهَ عَنِ الْحَجَّالِ عَنْ عَلِیِّ بْنِ الْحَکَمِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ هَارُونَ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ مَشَی إِلَی الْمَسَاجِدِ لَمْ یَضَعْ رِجْلَهُ عَلَی رَطْبٍ وَ لَا یَابِسٍ إِلَّا سَبَّحَتْ لَهُ الْأَرْضُ إِلَی الْأَرَضِینَ السَّابِعَهِ.
hadees_english: 1. It was narrated to me by Muhammad b. Ali b. Majluwayh who said it was narrated to me by Muhammad b. Yahya al-’Attar from Muhammad b. Ahmad from Ya’la b. Hamzah from al-Hajjal from Ali b. al-Hakam from Muhammad b. Harun from Abi Abdillah who said: “One who goes to mosque on foot, everything will glorify Allah for him from the place where he steps on be it wet or dry till the seventh heaven.

chapter: Chapter 63 | Reward of Quranic conversation and making mosque one’s home
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی حَمْزَهُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ الْعَلَوِیُّ ره قَالَ أَخْبَرَنِی عَلِیُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِیمَ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنِ النَّوْفَلِیِّ عَنِ السَّکُونِیِّ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ آبَائِهِ ع قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ص مَنْ کَانَ الْقُرْآنُ حَدِیثَهُ وَ الْمَسْجِدُ بَیْتَهُ بَنَی اللَّهُ لَهُ بَیْتاً فِی الْجَنَّهِ.
hadees_english: 1. Imam Ja’far Sadiq narrates from his predecessors that the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) said, “One who makes Quran his conversation and mosque his home Allah will make a house for him in Paradise.”

chapter: Chapter 64 | Reward of going to mosque after performing ablution
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَیْنِ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ عَنْ کُلَیْبٍ الصَّیْدَاوِیِّ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَکْتُوبٌ فِی التَّوْرَاهِ أَنَّ بُیُوتِی فِی الْأَرْضِ الْمَسَاجِدُ فَطُوبَی لِمَنْ تَطَهَّرَ فِی بَیْتِهِ ثُمَّ زَارَنِی وَ حَقٌّ عَلَی الْمَزُورِ أَنْ یُکْرِمَ الزَّائِرَ.
hadees_english: 1. My father said: it was narrated to me by Abdillah b. Ja’far from Muhammad b. al-Hussain from Safwan from Kulayb al-Saydawi from Abi Abdillah who said: “It is written in the Old Testament: ‘My houses on earth are mosques. A slave of Mine who performs ablution in his house and come to My house for meeting Me shall have Tooba (a good fortune). Know that it is necessary for the host to honor his guest.”

chapter: Chapter 64 | Reward of going to mosque after performing ablution
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ الصَّفَّارِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِیسَی عَنِ الْحُسَیْنِ بْنِ جَبَلَهَ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ سُلَیْمَانَ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ عَنْ أَبِیهِ قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ص قَالَ اللَّهُ تَبَارَکَ وَ تَعَالَی أَلَا إِنَّ بُیُوتِی فِی الْأَرْضِ الْمَسَاجِدُ تُضِی ءُ لِأَهْلِ السَّمَاءِ کَمَا تُضِی ءُ النُّجُومُ لِأَهْلِ الْأَرْضِ أَلَا طُوبَی لِمَنْ کَانَتِ الْمَسَاجِدُ بُیُوتَهُ أَلَا طُوبَی لِعَبْدٍ تَوَضَّأَ فِی بَیْتِهِ ثُمَّ زَارَنِی فِی بَیْتِی أَلَا إِنَّ عَلَی الْمَزُورِ کَرَامَهَ الزَّائِرِ أَلَا بَشِّرِ الْمَشَّاءِینَ فِی الظُّلُمَاتِ إِلَی الْمَسَاجِدِ بِالنُّورِ السَّاطِعِ یَوْمَ الْقِیَامَهِ.
hadees_english: 2. The Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) says, “Know that Allah says, ‘My houses on the earth are mosques. As stars provide light to the people on earth mosques do to the people on heaven. Know that those people have Tooba (good fortune) whose houses are mosques. Also know that a slave of Mine who performs ablution in his house and come to My house for meeting Me shall have Tooba (good fortune). Know that it is necessary for the host to honor his guest. Know that there are glad tidings of bright light on the Day of Judgment for one who visits the mosque in darkness.

chapter: Chapter 64 | Reward of going to mosque after performing ablution
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ هِشَامٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ إِسْمَاعِیلَ عَنْ عَلِیِّ بْنِ الْحَکَمِ عَنْ سَیْفِ بْنِ عَمِیرَهَ عَنْ سَعْدِ بْنِ ظَرِیفٍ عَنِ الْأَصْبَغِ بْنِ نُبَاتَهَ قَالَ قَالَ أَمِیرُ الْمُؤْمِنِینَ ع إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ لَیَهُمُّ بِعَذَابِ أَهْلِ الْأَرْضِ جَمِیعاً لَا یُحَاشِی مِنْهُمْ أَحَداً إِذَا عَمِلُوا بِالْمَعَاصِی وَ اجْتَرَحُوا السَّیِّئَاتِ فَإِذَا نَظَرَ إِلَی الشِّیبِ نَاقِلِی أَقْدَامِهِمْ إِلَی الصَّلَاهِ وَ الْوِلْدَانِ یَتَعَلَّمُونَ الْقُرْآنَ رَحِمَهُمْ فَأَخَّرَ ذَلِکَ عَنْهُمْ.
hadees_english: 3. Amirul Momineen says, “Whenever people of the earth commit sins or get involved in wrong deeds, the Almighty Allah intends to send down His chastisement on the people of the world. However when He sees elderly people praying and young children learning Quran, He feels pity on them and does not send down His chastisement.”

chapter: Chapter 65 | Reward of offering five times’ prayers on prime time
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنَا سَعْدُ بْنُ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِیسَی عَنِ الْحُسَیْنِ بْنِ سَعْدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِی عُمَیْرٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ الْحَجَّاجِ عَنْ أَبَانِ بْنِ تَغْلِبَ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع یَا أَبَانُ هَذِهِ الصَّلَوَاتُ الْخَمْسُ الْمَفْرُوضَاتُ مَنْ أَقَامَهُنَّ وَ حَافَظَ عَلَی مَوَاقِیتِهِنَّ لَقِیَ اللَّهَ یَوْمَ الْقِیَامَهِ وَ لَهُ عِنْدَهُ عَهْدٌ یُدْخِلُهُ بِهِ الْجَنَّهَ وَ مَنْ لَمْ یُصَلِّهِنَّ لِمَوَاقِیتِهِنَّ فَذَلِکَ إِلَیْهِ إِنْ شَاءَ غَفَرَ لَهُ وَ إِنْ شَاءَ عَذَّبَهُ.
hadees_english: 1. Imam Ja’far Sadiq says, “O Abaan! One who offers obligatory prayers five times and that too on prime time, he will go to Allah with an assurance on the Day of Judgment and Allah would make him enter Paradise. And for a person who did not offer prayers on time, Allah has choice whether to punish him or forgive him.”

chapter: Chapter 65 | Reward of offering five times’ prayers on prime time
hadees_arabic: وَ بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحُسَیْنِ بْنِ سَعْدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِی عُمَیْرٍ عَنْ إِسْمَاعِیلَ الْبَصْرِیِّ عَنِ الْفَضْلِ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: دَخَلَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ص الْمَسْجِدَ وَ فِیهِ نَاسٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِهِ قَالَ تَدْرُونَ مَا قَالَ رَبُّکُمْ قَالُوا اللَّهُ وَ رَسُولُهُ أَعْلَمُ قَالَ إِنَّ رَبَّکُمْ یَقُولُ هَذِهِ الصَّلَوَاتُ الْخَمْسُ الْمَفْرُوضَاتُ فَمَنْ صَلَّاهُنَّ لِوَقْتِهِنَّ وَ حَافَظَ عَلَیْهِنَّ لَقِیَنِی یَوْمَ الْقِیَامَهِ وَ لَهُ عِنْدِی عَهْدٌ أُدْخِلُهُ بِهِ الْجَنَّهَ وَ مَنْ لَمْ یُصَلِّهِنَّ لِوَقْتِهِنَّ وَ لَمْ یُحَافِظْ عَلَیْهِنَّ فَذَلِکَ إِلَیَّ إِنْ شِئْتُ عَذَّبْتُهُ وَ إِنْ شِئْتُ غَفَرْتُ لَهُ.
hadees_english: 2. And from the previous chain from al-Hussain b. Sa’d from Ibn Abi ’Umayr from Ismail al-Basri from al-Fadhl from Abi Abdillah who said: “Messenger of Allah ﷺ entered the mosque where his companions were gathered. He questioned them, 'Are you familiar with what your Lord has stated?' They replied, 'Allah and His Messenger know best.' He then said, 'Verily, your Lord has stated: 'One who offers obligatory prayers five times and that too on prime time, he will come to Me with an assurance on the Day of Judgment and I would make him enter Paradise. And for a person who did not offer prayers on time, I have choice whether to punish him or forgive him’.”'

chapter: Chapter 66 | Reward of Nafila prayers
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی سَعْدُ بْنُ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ الْوَاسِطِیِّ النَّحَّاسِ عَنْ مُوسَی بْنِ بَکْرٍ عَنْ أَبِی الْحَسَنِ ع قَالَ: صَلَاهُ النَّوَافِلِ قُرْبَانُ کُلِّ مُؤْمِنٍ.
hadees_english: 1. My father said: it was narrated to me by Sa’d b. Abdillah from Ahmad b. Abi Abdillah from al-Hassan b. Mahbub from al-Hassan al-Wasiti al-Nahhas from Musa b. Bakr from Abi al-Hassan who said: “Nafila prayers are always near to a believer.”

chapter: Chapter 67 | Reward of lighting a lamp in the mosque
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عَلِیِّ بْنِ مَاجِیلَوَیْهِ ره عَنْ عَمِّهِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِی الْقَاسِمِ عَنْ أَبِی مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَلِیٍّ الصَّیْرَفِیِّ عَنْ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ شکر [یَشْکُرَ] الْبَاهِلِیِّ عَنِ الْکَاهِلِیِّ عَنْ أَنَسٍ قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ص مَنْ أَسْرَجَ فِی مَسْجِدٍ مِنْ مَسَاجِدِ اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ سِرَاجاً لَمْ تَزَلِ الْمَلَائِکَهُ وَ حَمَلَهُ الْعَرْشِ یَسْتَغْفِرُونَ لَهُ مَا دَامَ فِی ذَلِکَ الْمَسْجِدِ ضَوْءٌ مِنَ السِّرَاجِ.
hadees_english: 1. The Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) says, “One who lights a lamp in the mosque of Allah the people of heaven and Allah’s angels seek repentance for that person till the time that lamp is on in the mosque.”

title: Thawāb al-Aʿmāl wa ʿiqāb al-Aʿmāl
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
translator: Sayed Athar Husain Rizvi & Sayed Maqsood Athar
description: Thawāb al-Aʿmāl wa ʿIqāb al-Aʿmāl is a remarkable collection of Ḥadīths collected by al-Shaykh al-Ṣadūq, a preeminent Shīʿa scholar of the 4th/10th century. Thawāb al-Aʿmāl wa ʿIqāb al-Aʿmāl delineates virtuous and sinful deeds, elucidating their spiritual consequences which lead to either reward or punishment. It has long served as an invaluable resource for both Shīʿa scholars and the general Shīʿa population and is celebrated as one of the most notable Shīʿa Ḥadīth collections. The author's motivation for writing this book was rooted in the prophetic hadith: "The one who leads people to good deeds is as their doer." Shaykh al-Ṣadūq emphasised that his primary goal in authoring the book was to seek the reward and satisfaction of God. The book is structured into two primary parts. The first part, "Thawāb al-Aʿmāl," encompasses 788 Ḥadīths arranged under 389 titles, detailing the spiritual rewards for performing righteous actions. The second part, "ʿIqāb al-Aʿmāl," includes 331 Ḥadīths distributed under 131 titles, focusing on the punitive consequences of committing sinful actions.
chapter: Chapter 68 | Reward of retaining spit in the mouth during Salaat
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره عَنْ سَعْدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَلِیِّ بْنِ حَسَّانَ عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ دَارَهَ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ حَبَسَ رِیقَهُ إِجْلَالًا لِلَّهِ تَعَالَی فِی صَلَاتِهِ أَوْرَثَهُ اللَّهُ صِحَّهً حَتَّی الْمَمَاتِ.
hadees_english: 1. My father from Sa’d b. Abdillah from Ahmad b. Muhammad b. Ali b. Ahmad from Sahl b. Darihi from his father from Abi Abdillah who said: “One who retains his saliva during Salat out of respect of Allah’s Majesty and His Honor, Allah keeps him healthy till his death.”

chapter: Chapter 69 | Reward of offering prayer in Masjidul Haraam
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی عَلِیُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِیمَ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ عَلِیِّ بْنِ مَعْبَدٍ عَنِ الْحُسَیْنِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ أَبِی الْحَسَنِ الرِّضَا عَنْ آبَائِهِ ع قَالَ قَالَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عَلِیٍّ الْبَاقِرُ ع صَلَاهٌ فِی الْمَسْجِدِ الْحَرَامِ أَفْضَلُ مِنْ مِائَهِ أَلْفِ صَلَاهٍ فِی غَیْرِهِ مِنَ الْمَسَاجِدِ.
hadees_english: 1. Imam Ridha narrates from his predecessors that the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) said, “The reward of a Salaat offered in Masjidul Haraam is more than the reward of a hundred thousand prayers offered in some other mosque.”

chapter: Chapter 70 | Reward of offering Prayer in Masjidun Nabawi
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ عَنْ هَارُونَ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ مَسْعَدَهَ بْنِ صَدَقَهَ عَنِ الصَّادِقِ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ آبَائِهِ ع قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ص صَلَاهٌ فِی مَسْجِدِی تَعْدِلُ عِنْدَ اللَّهِ عَشَرَهَ آلَافِ صَلَاهٍ فِی غَیْرِهِ مِنَ الْمَسَاجِدِ إِلَّا الْمَسْجِدَ الْحَرَامَ فَإِنَّ الصَّلَاهَ فِیهِ تَعْدِلُ مِائَهَ أَلْفِ صَلَاهٍ.
hadees_english: 1. Imam Ja’far Sadiq narrates from his ancestors that the Holy Prophet ﷺ said, “The reward of offering a Prayer in Masjidun Nabawi is equal to the reward of ten thousand Prayers offered in any other mosque except the Prayer offered in Masjidul Haraam whose reward is equal to the reward of a hundred thousand Prayers offered in another mosque.”

chapter: Chapter 71 | Reward of offering Prayer between Masjidul Haraam and Masjidun Nabawi
hadees_arabic: arabicnotfound
hadees_english: 1. Hasan bin Ali Washshaa says that he asked Imam Ridha , “Is the reward of offering Prayer in Masjidun Nabawi and Masjidul Haraam equal? He replied, “Yes, and the prayers recited between them is equal to 2.000 prayers recited elsewhere.”

chapter: Chapter 72 | Reward of offering Prayer in Masjid-e-Kufa
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی أَحْمَدُ بْنُ إِدْرِیسَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِیٍّ عَنْ أَبِی حَمْزَهَ عَنْ أَبِی بَصِیرٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ سَمِعْتُهُ یَقُولُ نِعْمَ الْمَسْجِدُ مَسْجِدُ الْکُوفَهِ صَلَّی فِیهِ أَلْفُ نَبِیٍّ وَ أَلْفُ وَصِیٍّ وَ مِنْهُ فارَ التَّنُّورُ وَ فِیهِ نُجِرَتِ السَّفِینَهُ مَیْمَنَتُهُ رِضْوَانُ اللَّهِ وَ وَسَطُهُ رَوْضَهٌ مِنْ رِیَاضِ الْجَنَّهِ وَ مَیْسَرَتُهُ مَکْرٌ. فَقُلْتُ لِأَبِی مَا الْمَعْنِیُّ بِقَوْلِهِ قَالَ یَعْنِی مَنَازِلَ الشَّیْطَانِ
hadees_english: 1. Abu Baseer says that he heard Imam Ja’far Sadiq saying, “Masjid-e-Kufa is a real mosque for one thousand prophets and one thousand Wasis have offered Salaat in this mosque. During the time of Nuh , water started coming out from this place and his Ark was built over here only. Its right side possesses the pleasure of Allah. Its middle has a garden of Paradise and its left has Makr.” He asked, “What do you mean by Makr?” Imam replied, “It implies the buildings of Shaitaan.”

chapter: Chapter 72 | Reward of offering Prayer in Masjid-e-Kufa
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی سَعْدُ بْنُ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ سَعِیدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا الْحَسَنِ الرِّضَا ع یَقُولُ الصَّلَاهُ فِی مَسْجِدِ الْکُوفَهِ فَرْداً أَفْضَلُ مِنْ سَبْعِینَ صَلَاهً فِی غَیْرِهِ جَمَاعَهً.
hadees_english: 2. Muhammad bin Sinaan says that he heard Imam Ridha say, “The reward of offering a prayer in Masjid-e-Kufa alone is better than the reward of offering seventy prayers in congregation in other mosques.”

chapter: Chapter 72 | Reward of offering Prayer in Masjid-e-Kufa
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عَلِیِّ بْنِ مَاجِیلَوَیْهِ ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی عَمِّی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَبِی الْقَاسِمِ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ الْبَرْقِیِّ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنِ الْمُفَضَّلِ بْنِ عُمَرَ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: صَلَاهٌ فِی مَسْجِدِ الْکُوفَهِ تَعْدِلُ أَلْفَ صَلَاهٍ فِی غَیْرِهِ مِنَ الْمَسَاجِدِ.
hadees_english: 3. It was narrated to me by Muhammad b. Ali b. Majluwayh who said it was narrated to me by my uncle Muhammad b. Abi al-Qasim from Ahmad b. Muhammad b. Abi Abdillah al-Barqi from his father from Muhammad b. Sinan from al-Muffadhal b. Umar from Abi Abdillah who said: “A single prayer of Masjid-e- Kufa is equal to one thousand prayers of other mosques.”

chapter: Chapter 73 | Reward of offering Salaat in Baitul Muqaddas, Masjid-e-Azam, Masjid-e-Qabeelah and Masjid-e-Sooq
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی أَحْمَدُ بْنُ إِدْرِیسَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ حَسَّانَ الرَّازِیِّ عَنِ النَّوْفَلِیِّ عَنِ السَّکُونِیِّ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ آبَائِهِ عَنْ عَلِیٍّ ع قَالَ: صَلَاهٌ فِی الْبَیْتِ الْمُقَدَّسِ تَعْدِلُ أَلْفَ صَلَاهٍ وَ صَلَاهٌ فِی مَسْجِدِ الْأَعْظَمِ مِائَهُ صَلَاهٍ وَ صَلَاهٌ فِی مَسْجِدِ الْقَبِیلَهِ خَمْسٌ وَ عِشْرُونَ صَلَاهً وَ صَلَاهٌ فِی مَسْجِدِ السُّوقِ اثْنَتَیْ عَشْرَهَ صَلَاهً وَ صَلَاهُ الرَّجُلِ فِی بَیْتِهِ وَحْدَهُ صَلَاهٌ وَاحِدَهٌ.
hadees_english: 1. My father said: it was narrated to me by Ahmad b. Idris from Muhammad b. Ahmad from Muhammad b. Ahmad al-Razi from al-Nawfali from al-Sakuni from Ja’far b. Muhammad from his forefathers from Ali who said: “A single Salaat of Baitul Muqaddas is equal to one thousand prayers. A single prayer of Masjid-e-Azam is equal to one hundred prayers. A single prayer of Masjid-e-Qabeelah is equal to twenty-five prayers and a single prayer of Masjid-e-Sooq is equal to twelve prayers. A Salaat offered in one’s house is equal to a single prayer only.”

title: Thawāb al-Aʿmāl wa ʿiqāb al-Aʿmāl

chapter: Chapter 74 | Reward of sweeping the mosque floor
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُوسَی قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ الْعَطَّارُ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِیَادٍ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ بَشَّارٍ عَنْ عُبَیْدِ اللَّهِ الدِّهْقَانِ عَنْ عَبْدِ الْحَمِیدِ عَنْ أَبِی إِبْرَاهِیمَ ع قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ص مَنْ کَنَسَ الْمَسْجِدَ یَوْمَ الْخَمِیسِ لَیْلَهَ الْجُمُعَهِ فَأَخْرَجَ مِنْهُ التُّرَابَ قَدْرَ مَا یُذْرَی فِی الْعَیْنِ غُفِرَ لَهُ.
hadees_english: 1. It is narrated from Imam Musa Kadhim that the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) said, “If one sweeps the floor of a mosque on a Thursday night and cleans the quantity of dirt equal to the Antimony put in one’s eye then too Allah forgives him.”

chapter: Chapter 75 | Reward of Calling out the Azaan
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ الصَّفَّارُ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَیْنِ بْنِ أَبِی الْخَطَّابِ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ بَشِیرٍ الْعَرْزَمِیِّ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: أَطْوَلُ النَّاسِ أَعْنَاقاً یَوْمَ الْقِیَامَهِ الْمُؤَذِّنُونَ.
hadees_english: 1. It was narrated to me by Muhammad b. al-Hassan who said it was narrated to me by Muhammad b. al-Hassan al-Saffar from Muhammad b. al-Hussain b. Abi al-Khattab from Ja’far b. Basheer al-’Arzami from Abi Abdillah who said: “The most elevated people on the Day of Judgment will be those who used to call out the Azaan.”

chapter: Chapter 76 | Reward of saying Azaan for seven years
hadees_arabic: notfound
hadees_english: 1. Imam Muhammad Baqir says, “One who recites Azaan for seven years with an intention of seeking reward from Allah would appear on the Day of Judgment without any sin to his name.”

chapter: Chapter 77 | Reward of reciting Azaan in a Muslim city for a year
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی أَحْمَدُ بْنُ إِدْرِیسَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَلِیٍّ عَنْ مُصْعَبِ بْنِ سَلَّامٍ التَّیْمِیِّ عَنْ سَعْدِ بْنِ ظَرِیفٍ عَنْ أَبِی جَعْفَرٍ ع قَالَ: مَنْ أَذَّنَ سَبْعَ سِنِینَ مُحْتَسِباً جَاءَ یَوْمَ الْقِیَامَهِ وَ لَا ذَنْبَ لَهُ.
hadees_english: 1. My father said: it was narrated to me by Ahmad b. Idris from Muhammad b. Ali from Mus’ab b. Salam al-Taymi from Sa’d b. Dharif from Abi Ja’far who said: “Paradise becomes incumbent on one who recites Azaan for a year in a city having Muslim population.”

chapter: Chapter 78 | Reward of repeating Azaan
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ الْحِمْیَرِیُّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِیسَی عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ جَمِیلِ بْنِ صَالِحٍ عَنِ الْحَارِثِ بْنِ الْمُغِیرَهِ الْبَصْرِیِّ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ سَمِعَ الْمُؤَذِّنَ یَقُولُ أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَ أَشْهَدُ أَنَّ مُحَمَّداً رَسُولُ اللَّهِ فَقَالَ مُصَدِّقاً مُحْتَسِباً وَ أَنَا أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَ أَنَّ مُحَمَّداً رَسُولُ اللَّهِ أَکْتَفِی بِهَا عَنْ کُلِّ مَنْ أَبَی وَ جَحَدَ وَ أُعِینُ بِهَا مَنْ أَقَرَّ وَ شَهِدَ إِلَّا غَفَرَ اللَّهُ لَهُ بِعَدَدِ مَنْ أَنْکَرَ وَ جَحَدَ وَ بِعَدَدِ مَنْ أَقَرَّ وَ شَهِدَ.
hadees_english: 1. My father said: it was narrated to me by Abdillah b. Ja’far al-Himyari from Muhammad b. Isa from al-Hassan b. Mahbub from Jameel b. Salih from al-Harith b. al-Mughira al-Basri from Abi Abdillah who said: “One who hears the Muezzin say: Ash-hadu allaa ilaaha illallaahu wa ash-hadu anna muh’ammadar rasoolullaah and testifies it for the sake of seeking reward from Allah by saying Wa anaa ash-hadu allaa ilaaha illallaahu wa anna muh’ammadar rasoolullaahi aktafee bihimaa a’n kulli man abaa wa jah’ada wa uee’nu bihimaa man aqarra wa shahid Almighty Allah forgives him with the forgiveness equal to those who testify in this way and those who don’t.”

chapter: Chapter 79 | Reward of reciting Azaan for ten years seeking reward from Allah
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُوسَی بْنِ الْمُتَوَکِّلِ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ یَحْیَی عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ نَاجِیَهَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَلِیٍّ عَنْ مُصْعَبِ بْنِ سَلَّامٍ التَّیْمِیِّ عَنْ سَعْدِ بْنِ ظَرِیفٍ عَنْ أَبِی جَعْفَرٍ ع قَالَ: مَنْ أَذَّنَ عِشْرِینَ سَنَهً مُحْتَسِباً یَغْفِرُ اللَّهُ لَهُ مَدَّ بَصَرِهِ وَ مَدَّ صَوْتِهِ فِی السَّمَاءِ وَ یُصَدِّقُهُ کُلُّ رَطْبٍ وَ یَابِسٍ سَمِعَهُ وَ لَهُ بِکُلِّ مَنْ یُصَلِّی مَعَهُ فِی مَسْجِدِهِ سَهْمٌ وَ لَهُ مِنْ کُلِّ مَنْ یُصَلِّی بِصَوْتِهِ حَسَنَهٌ.
hadees_english: 1. It was narrated to me by Muhammad b. Musa b. al-Mutawakil who said it was narrated to me by Muhammad b. Yahya from Muhammad b. Ahmad from Muhammad b. Najayh from Muhammad b. Ali from Mus’ab b. Salam al-Taymi from Sa’d b. Dharif from Abi Ja’far who said: “One who recites Azaan for ten years seeking reward from Allah, Allah would forgive him with the forgiveness equal to the number of times he looks at the sky and number of times his voice comes out. Everything, be it dry or wet will testify it. All those who hear this person and pray inside the mosque will also get a part of this reward.”

chapter: Chapter 80 | Reward of Muezzin between Azaan and Iqamah
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عَلِیِّ بْنِ مَاجِیلَوَیْهِ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی عَمِّی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَبِی الْقَاسِمِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَلِیٍّ عَنْ عِیسَی بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ جَدِّهِ عَنْ عَلِیٍّ ع قَالَ: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ص لِلْمُؤَذِّنِ فِیمَا بَیْنَ الْأَذَانِ وَ الْإِقَامَهِ مِثْلُ أَجْرِ الشَّهِیدِ الْمُتَشَحِّطِ بِدَمِهِ فِی سَبِیلِ اللَّهِ تَعَالَی قَالَ فَقُلْتُ یَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ إِنَّهُمْ یَخْتَارُونَ الْأَذَانَ وَ الْإِقَامَهَ فَقَالَ کَلَّا إِنَّهُ یَأْتِی عَلَی النَّاسِ زَمَانٌ یَطْرَحُونَ الْأَذَانَ عَلَی ضُعَفَائِهِمْ فَتِلْکَ لُحُومٌ حَرَّمَهَا اللَّهُ عَلَی النَّارِ.
hadees_english: 1. It was narrated to me by Muhammad b. Ali b. Majluwayh who said it was narrated to me by my uncle Muhammad b. Abi al-Qasim from Muhammad b. Ali from Isa b. Abdillah from his father from his grandfather from Ali who said: “No, a time will come when the responsibility of Azaan and Iqamah will be entrusted only to weak and helpless people. Hence the fire of Hell is made unlawful on their weak flesh.”

chapter: Chapter 81 | Reward of offering Salaat along with Azaan and Iqamah
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره عَنْ سَعْدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ سَلَمَهَ بْنِ الْخَطَّابِ عَنْ إِبْرَاهِیمَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ الثَّقَفِیِّ عَنْ مَیْمُونٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ الْمُطَّلِبِ بْنِ زِیَادٍ عَنْ أَبَانِ بْنِ تَغْلِبَ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِی لَیْلَی عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ یَرْفَعُهُ قَالَ قَالَ عَلِیُّ بْنُ أَبِی طَالِبٍ ع مَنْ صَلَّی بِأَذَانٍ وَ إِقَامَهٍ صلاه [صَلَّی] خَلْفَهُ صَفٌّ مِنَ الْمَلَائِکَهِ لَا یُرَی طَرَفَاهُ- وَ مَنْ صَلَّی بِإِقَامَهٍ صلاه [صَلَّی] خَلْفَهُ مَلَکٌ.
hadees_english: 1. For a person who recites Azaan and Iqamah angels would stand in rows behind him. Those rows would be so wide that their ends would be unknown. And the person who offers Salaat after saying Iqamah; an angel would pray behind him.”

chapter: Chapter 81 | Reward of offering Salaat along with Azaan and Iqamah
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عَلِیِّ بْنِ مَاجِیلَوَیْهِ ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی عَمِّی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَبِی الْقَاسِمِ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنِ الْمُفَضَّلِ بْنِ عُمَرَ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع مَنْ صَلَّی بِأَذَانٍ وَ إِقَامَهٍ صلاه [صَلَّی] خَلْفَهُ صَفَّانِ مِنَ الْمَلَائِکَهِ وَ مَنْ صَلَّی بِإِقَامَهٍ بِغَیْرِ أَذَانٍ صَلَّی خَلْفَهُ صَفٌّ وَاحِدٌ قُلْتُ لَهُ وَ کَمْ مِقْدَارُ کُلِّ صَفٍّ فَقَالَ أَقَلُّهُ مَا بَیْنَ الْمَشْرِقِ وَ الْمَغْرِبِ وَ أَکْثَرُهُ مَا بَیْنَ السَّمَاءِ وَ الْأَرْضِ.
hadees_english: 2. Imam Ja’far Sadiq says, “One who offers Salaat after saying Azaan and Iqamah two rows of angels pray behind him. If a person offers Salaat after saying Iqamah only, one row of angels prays behind him.” The narrator asked, “How wide is that row?” Imam replied, “The shortest is from east to west and the longest from earth to heaven.”

chapter: Chapter 82 | Reward of reciting Surah Ikhlaas, Surah Qadr and Ayatal Kursi in every rakat of a recommended Salaat
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ یَحْیَی الْعَطَّارِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَلِیٍّ عَنْ عَلِیِّ بْنِ أَسْبَاطٍ عَنْ عَمِّهِ یَعْقُوبَ بْنِ سَالِمٍ عَنْ أَبِی الْحَسَنِ الْعَبْدِیِّ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع مَنْ قَرَأَ قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَدٌ وَ إِنَّا أَنْزَلْناهُ فِی لَیْلَهِ الْقَدْرِ وَ آیَهَ الْکُرْسِیِّ فِی کُلِّ رَکْعَهٍ مِنْ تَطَوُّعِهِ فَقَدْ فَتَحَ اللَّهُ لَهُ بِأَعْظَمِ أَعْمَالِ الْآدَمِیِّینَ إِلَّا مَنْ أَشْبَهَهُ فَزَادَ عَلَیْهِ.
hadees_english: 1. Imam Ja’far Sadiq says, “One who recites Qul huwallaahu ah’ad, innaa anzalnaahu fee lailatil qadr and ayatal kursi in a recommended prayer Allah would consider his deed best except for that person who has performed it more than him.”

chapter: Chapter 83 | Excellence and reward of Qunoot
hadees_arabic: 14- أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی أَحْمَدُ بْنُ إِدْرِیسَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ عَلِیِّ بْنِ إِسْمَاعِیلَ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ بْنِ یَحْیَی عَنْ أَبِی أَیُّوبَ عَنْ أَبِی بَصِیرٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ آبَائِهِ ع عَنْ أَبِی ذَرٍّ قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ص أَطْوَلُکُمْ قُنُوتاً فِی دَارِ الدُّنْیَا أَطْوَلُکُمْ رَاحَهً یَوْمَ الْقِیَامَهِ فِی الْمَوْقِفِ.
hadees_english: 1. It is narrated by Imam Ja’far Sadiq from his predecessors from Abu Zar (r.a.) that the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) said, “The longer the Qunoot of a person in this world, the longer would be his peace in Mauqif (stages) on the Day of Judgment.”

chapter: Chapter 84 | Reward of a complete Ruku
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُوسَی بْنِ الْمُتَوَکِّلِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ یَحْیَی الْعَطَّارِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنِ السِّنْدِیِّ بْنِ الرَّبِیعِ عَنْ سَعِیدِ بْنِ جَنَاحٍ قَالَ: کُنْتُ عِنْدَ أَبِی جَعْفَرٍ ع فِی مَنْزِلٍ بِالْمَدِینَهِ فَقَالَ مُبْتَدِئاً مَنْ أَتَمَّ رَکْعَهً لَمْ تَدْخُلْهُ وَحْشَهٌ فِی قَبْرِهِ.
hadees_english: 1. It was narrated to me by Muhammad b. Musa b. al-Mutawakil from Muhammad b. Yahya al-’Attar from Muhammad b. Ahmad from al-Sindi b. al-Rabee’ from Sa’eed b. Janah who said: “For one who completes his Ruku, fear won’t enter his grave.”

chapter: Chapter 85 | Reward of a Sajdah
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ الصَّفَّارُ عَنِ الْعَبَّاسِ بْنِ مَعْرُوفٍ عَنْ مُوسَی بْنِ الْقَاسِمِ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ بْنِ یَحْیَی عَنْ کُلَیْبٍ الصَّیْدَاوِیِّ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ آبَائِهِ ع قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ص مَنْ سَجَدَ سَجْدَهً حُطَّ عَنْهُ بِهَا خَطِیئَهٌ وَ رُفِعَ لَهُ بِهَا دَرَجَهٌ.
hadees_english: 1. Imam Ja’far Sadiq narrates from his predecessors that the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) said, “One who prostrates once, one of his sins is forgiven and a position would be raised for him.”

chapter: Chapter 86 | Reward of keeping the palms on the ground during Sajdah
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنَا عَلِیُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِیمَ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنِ النَّوْفَلِیِّ عَنِ السَّکُونِیِّ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ آبَائِهِ ع قَالَ قَالَ أَمِیرُ الْمُؤْمِنِینَ ع إِذَا سَجَدَ أَحَدُکُمْ فَلْیُبَاشِرْ بِکَفَّیْهِ الْأَرْضَ لَعَلَّ اللَّهَ یَصْرِفُ عَنْهُ الْغُلَّ یَوْمَ الْقِیَامَهِ.
hadees_english: 1. Imam Ja’far Sadiq narrates from his predecessors that Amirul Momineen said, “When one of you performs the Sajdah you must place the palms of your hands on the ground, perhaps by that you will be exempted from the chains on the Day of Qiyamat.”

chapter: Chapter 87 | Reward of prolonging a Sajdah
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره عَنْ سَعْدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحُسَیْنِ بْنِ سَعِیدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِی عُمَیْرٍ عَنْ مُعَاوِیَهَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع وَ هُوَ یَقُولُ إِنَّ الْعَبْدَ إِذَا أَطَالَ السُّجُودَ حَیْثُ لَا یَرَاهُ أَحَدٌ قَالَ الشَّیْطَانُ وَا وَیْلَاهْ أَطَاعُوا وَ عَصَیْتُ وَ سَجَدُوا وَ أَبَیْتُ.
hadees_english: 1. Imam Ja’far Sadiq said, “One who performs a prolonged Sajdah without anyone seeing him Shaitaan exclaims, ‘Alas! He obeyed while I disobeyed. They prostrated and I refused.’”

hadees_english: 2. Imam Ja’far Sadiq says, “The state of a slave nearest to his Lord is the state of prostration.”

chapter: Chapter 88 | Reward of reciting Durood in the state of Ruku, Sajdah and Qiyam
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عَلِیِّ بْنِ مَاجِیلَوَیْهِ ره عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ یَحْیَی عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِیسَی عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِی حَمْزَهَ عَنْ أَبِیهِ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ ع مَنْ قَالَ فِی رُکُوعِهِ وَ سُجُودِهِ وَ قِیَامِهِ اللَّهُمَّ صَلِّ عَلَی مُحَمَّدٍ وَ آلِ مُحَمَّدٍ کَتَبَ اللَّهُ لَهُ ذَلِکَ بِمِثْلِ الرُّکُوعِ وَ السُّجُودِ وَ الْقِیَامِ.
hadees_english: 1. Imam Muhammad Baqir says, “One who recites: Allaahumma s’alli a’laa muh’ammadinw wa aali muh’ammad in his Ruku, his Sajdah and his Qiyam, Allah writes for him a reward like that of Ruku, Sajdah or Qiyam.”

chapter: Chapter 89 | Reward of Sajdah-e-Shukr
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ قَالَ حَدَّثَنَا مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ الصَّفَّارُ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ جَمِیلِ بْنِ صَالِحٍ عَنْ ذَرِیحٍ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع أَیُّمَا مُؤْمِنٍ سَجَدَ لِلَّهِ سَجْدَهً لِشُکْرِ نِعْمَهٍ مِنْ غَیْرِ صَلَاهٍ کَتَبَ اللَّهُ بِهَا عَشْرَ حَسَنَاتٍ وَ مَحَا عَنْهُ عَشْرَ سَیِّئَاتٍ وَ رَفَعَ لَهُ عَشْرَ دَرَجَاتٍ فِی الْجِنَانِ.
hadees_english: 1. Imam Ja’far Sadiq says, “One who prostrates for thanking for the bounties apart from Salaat, Allah writes for him ten rewards, erases ten of his sins and increase his position by ten levels in Paradise.”

chapter: Chapter 90 | Reward of Salaat
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنَا مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ یَحْیَی عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ مُوسَی بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ عَنْ عُبَیْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ وَاصِلِ بْنِ سُلَیْمَانَ وَ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ص مَا مِنْ صَلَاهٍ یَحْضُرُ وَقْتُهَا إِلَّا نَادَی مَلَکٌ بَیْنَ یَدَیِ النَّاسِ أَیُّهَا النَّاسُ قُومُوا إِلَی نِیرَانِکُمُ الَّتِی أَوْقَدْتُمُوهَا عَلَی ظُهُورِکُمْ فَأَطْفِئُوهَا بِصَلَاتِکُمْ.
hadees_english: 1. Imam Ja’far Sadiq narrates that the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) said, “Whenever the time of Salaat starts, an angel calls out to the people, ‘O people, stand up! Extinguish the fire, which you have lighted on your backs with the help of Salaat.”

chapter: Chapter 90 | Reward of Salaat
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ الصَّفَّارُ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَیْنِ بْنِ أَبِی الْخَطَّابِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ الْعَزِیزِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِی یَعْفُورٍ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع إِذَا صَلَّیْتَ صَلَاهً فَرِیضَهً فَصَلِّهَا لِوَقْتِهَا صَلَاهَ مُوَدِّعٍ یَخَافُ أَنْ لَا یَعُودَ إِلَیْهَا أَبَداً ثُمَّ اصْرِفْ بِبَصَرِکَ إِلَی مَوْضِعِ سُجُودِکَ فَلَوْ تَعْلَمُ مَنْ عَنْ یَمِینِکَ وَ شِمَالِکَ لَأَحْسَنْتَ صَلَاتَکَ وَ اعْلَمْ أَنَّکَ قُدَّامَ مَنْ یَرَاکَ وَ لَا تَرَاهُ.
hadees_english: 2. Imam Ja’far Sadiq says, “O Abdullah, when you offer an obligatory prayer, offer it on time. Else it is possible that you might lose the opportunity to do so. Focus your eyes on the place of your prostrations while offering Salaat. You pray carefully as if there is someone around you. Know that He is seeing you and you are not able to see Him.”

chapter: Chapter 90 | Reward of Salaat
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُوسَی بْنِ الْمُتَوَکِّلِ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی عَلِیُّ بْنُ الْحُسَیْنِ السَّعْدَآبَادِیُّ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ الْبَرْقِیِّ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِی عُمَیْرٍ عَنْ جَمِیلٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: لِلْمُصَلِّی ثَلَاثُ خِصَالٍ إِذَا قَامَ فِی صَلَاتِهِ یَتَنَاثَرُ عَلَیْهِ الْبِرُّ مِنْ أَعْنَانِ السَّمَاءِ إِلَی مَفْرَقِ رَأْسِهِ وَ تَحُفُّ بِهِ الْمَلَائِکَهُ مِنْ قَدَمَیْهِ إِلَی أَعْنَانِ السَّمَاءِ وَ مَلَکٌ یُنَادِی أَیُّهَا الْمُصَلِّی لَوْ تَعْلَمُ مَنْ تُنَاجِی مَا انْفَتَلْتَ.
hadees_english: 3. It was narrated to me by Muhammad b. Musa b. al-Mutawakil who said it was narrated to me by Ali b. al-Hussain al-Sa’dabadi from Ahmad b. Abi Abdillah al-Barqi from his father from Muhammad b. Abi ’Umayr from Jameel from Abi Abdillah who said: “There are three benefits of Salaat – whenever a person stands for Salaat, good deeds descend on him from all the corners of the heaven, angels surround that person from the place under his feet till the heaven and an angel calls out, ‘O worshipper! If you had known to Whom you are supplicating you would have never missed it.”

chapter: Chapter 91 | Reward of offering Morning Salaat in its prime time
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ الصَّفَّارِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ مُوسَی الْخَشَّابِ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ جَبَلَهَ عَنْ غِیَاثِ بْنِ کَلُّوبٍ عَنْ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ: قُلْتُ لِأَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع یَا أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ أَخْبِرْنِی عَنْ أَفْضَلِ الْمَوَاقِیتِ فِی صَلَاهِ الْفَجْرِ قَالَ مَعَ طُلُوعِ الْفَجْرِ إِنَّ اللَّهَ تَعَالَی یَقُولُ- إِنَّ قُرْآنَ الْفَجْرِ کانَ مَشْهُوداً یَعْنِی صَلَاهَ الْفَجْرِ تَشْهَدُهَا مَلَائِکَهُ النَّهَارِ وَ مَلَائِکَهُ اللَّیْلِ فَإِذَا صَلَّی الْعَبْدُ صَلَاهَ الصُّبْحِ مَعَ طُلُوعِ الْفَجْرِ أُثْبِتَتْ لَهُ مَرَّتَیْنِ تُثْبِتُهَا مَلَائِکَهُ اللَّیْلِ وَ مَلَائِکَهُ النَّهَارِ.
hadees_english: 1. It was narrated to me by Muhammad b. al-Hassan from Muhammad b. al-Hassan al-Saffar from al-Hassan b. Musa al-Khashab from Abdillah b. Jabalah from Ghiyath b. Kalub from Ishaq b. Ammar who said: I asked Abi Abdillah : "Oh Aba Abdillah, inform me about the best times during the Fajr prayer." He replied: "It is at the time of the dawn. Verily, Allah, the Most High, says, 'Indeed, the recitation of the Qur'an at dawn is ever witnessed.' (17:78). Meaning, it is witnessed by the angels of the day and the angels of the night. So when the servant prays Salaat al-Subh at the start of dawn, its reward would be noted down twice, noted by the angels of the night and the angels of the day.”

chapter: Chapter 92 | Excellence of prime time over the last moments
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُوسَی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْعَبَّاسِ بْنِ مَعْرُوفٍ عَنْ بَکْرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ الْأَزْدِیِّ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع فَضْلُ الْوَقْتِ الْأَوَّلِ عَلَی الْأَخِیرِ [خَیْرٌ] لِلْمُؤْمِنِ [مِنْ] وُلْدِهِ وَ مَالِهِ
hadees_english: 1. Imam Ja’far Sadiq says, “The excellence of prime time over the last moments for a believer is more than his children and his wealth.”

chapter: Chapter 92 | Excellence of prime time over the last moments
hadees_arabic: وَ فِی حَدِیثٍ آخَرَ قَالَ الصَّادِقُ ع فَضْلُ الْوَقْتِ الْأَوَّلِ عَلَی الْأَخِیرِ کَفَضْلِ الْآخِرَهِ عَلَی الدُّنْیَا.
hadees_english: 2. Imam Ja’far Sadiq says, “The excellence of prime time over the last moments is like the excellence of Hereafter over this world.”

chapter: Chapter 93 | Reward of offering obligatory prayers during prime time
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره عَنْ سَعْدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ سَعْدِ بْنِ أَبِی خَلَفٍ عَنْ أَبِی الْحَسَنِ مُوسَی ع قَالَ: الصَّلَوَاتُ الْمَفْرُوضَاتُ فِی أَوَّلِ وَقْتِهَا إِذَا أُقِیمَ حُدُودُهَا أَطْیَبُ رِیحاً مِنْ قَضِیبِ الْآسِ حِینَ یُؤْخَذُ مِنْ شَجَرِهِ فِی طِیبِهِ وَ رِیحِهِ وَ طَرَاوَتِهِ فَعَلَیْکُمْ بِالْوَقْتِ الْأَوَّلِ.
hadees_english: 1. Abi from Sa’d b. Abdillah from Ahmad b. Muhammad from al-Hassan b. Mahbub from Sa’d b. Abi Khalaf from Abi al-Hassan Musa who said: “If an obligatory prayer is offered in prime time fulfilling all the conditions a sweet smell would come out from it just like the sweet smell that comes out when a branch of tree is broken. Hence it is obligatory on you to offer Salaat at its prime time.”

chapter: Chapter 94 | Reward of Qasr prayers while travel
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی أَحْمَدُ بْنُ إِدْرِیسَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ هِلَالٍ عَنْ عِیسَی بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ الْهَاشِمِیِّ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ جَدِّهِ عَنْ عَلِیِّ بْنِ أَبِی طَالِبٍ ع قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ص خِیَارُکُمُ الَّذِینَ إِذَا سَافَرُوا قَصَّرُوا وَ أَفْطَرُوا.
hadees_english: 1. Amirul Momineen narrates that the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) said, “The best among you are those who offer Qasr prayer and do not observe fast during travel.”

chapter: Chapter 95 | Reward of offering Friday prayers during travel
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ زُرْعَهَ عَنْ سَمَاعَهَ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَبِیهِ ع قَالَ: أَیُّمَا مُسَافِرٍ صَلَّی الْجُمُعَهَ رَغْبَهً فِیهَا وَ حُبّاً لَهَا أَعْطَاهُ اللَّهُ أَجْرَ مِائَهِ جُمُعَهٍ لِلْمُقِیمِ.
hadees_english: 1. My father said: it was narrated to me by Abdillah b. Ja’far from Ahmad b. Abi Abdillah from his father from Zur’a from Sama’a from Ja’far b. Muhammad from his father who said: “If a traveler among you offers Friday Prayer for the sake of devotion and love of Almighty, Allah grants him reward equal to one hundred non-travelers’ Friday Salaat.”

chapter: Chapter 96 | Reward of offering Salaat in congregation
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی أَبِی ره بِإِسْنَادٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع إِنَّ الصَّلَاهَ فِی الْجَمَاعَهِ تَفْضُلُ عَلَی صَلَاهِ الْفَرْدِ ثلاث [بِثَلَاثٍ] وَ عِشْرِینَ دَرَجَهً تَکُونُ خَمْساً وَ عِشْرِینَ صَلَاهً.
hadees_english: 1. Imam Ja’far Sadiq says, “The excellence of congregational prayers is twenty three times that of prayer offered alone and this one congregational prayer is equal to twenty five prayers.”

title: Thawāb al-Aʿmāl wa ʿiqāb al-Aʿmāl

chapter: Chapter 96 | Reward of offering Salaat in congregation
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی عَلِیُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِیمَ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنِ النَّوْفَلِیِّ عَنِ السَّکُونِیِّ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ آبَائِهِ ع قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ص مَنْ أَتَی الْجَمَاعَهَ إِیمَاناً وَ احْتِسَاباً اسْتَأْنَفَ الْعَمَلَ.
hadees_english: 2. Imam Ja’far Sadiq narrates from his predecessors that the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) said, “For one who offers Salaat in congregation with faith and for seeking divine rewards, a new record of his deeds would be created (blotting out all sins he has committed before).”

chapter: Chapter 96 | Reward of offering Salaat in congregation
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ بِإِسْنَادِهِ عَنْ مُعَلَّی بْنِ خُنَیْسٍ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ یَحْیَی الْعَطَّارُ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ إِبْرَاهِیمَ بْنِ إِسْحَاقَ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ حَمَّادٍ الْأَنْصَارِیِّ عَنِ الْمُعَلَّی بْنِ خُنَیْسٍ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع یَقُولُ مَنْ وَافَقَ مِنْکُمْ یَوْمَ الْجُمُعَهِ فَلَا یَشْتَغِلَنَّ بِشَیْ ءٍ غَیْرِ الْعِبَادَهِ فَإِنَّ فِیهَا تُغْفَرُ للعباده [لِلْعِبَادِ] وَ تَنْزِلُ الرَّحْمَهُ.
hadees_english: 3. The narrator heard Imam Ja’far Sadiq say, “One who gets a Friday, should not get involved in anything except worship because people are forgiven and mercy is showered on this day.”

author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq

chapter: Chapter 97 | Reward of rising up for Salaat
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ عَنِ الْحُسَیْنِ وَ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ أَبَانٍ عَنِ الْحُسَیْنِ بْنِ سَعِیدٍ عَنْ أَیْمَنَ بْنِ مُحْرِزٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْفُضَیْلِ عَنْ أَبِی حَمْزَهَ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَا مِنْ عَبْدٍ مِنْ شِیعَتِنَا یَقُومُ إِلَی الصَّلَاهِ إِلَّا اکْتَنَفَهُ بِعَدَدِ مَنْ خَالَفَهُ مَلَائِکَهٌ یُصَلُّونَ خَلْفَهُ یَدْعُونَ اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ لَهُ حَتَّی یَفْرُغَ مِنْ صَلَاتِهِ.
hadees_english: 1. It was narrated to me by Muhammad b. al-Hassan from al-Hussain and al-Hassan b. Aban from al-Hussain b. Sa’eed from Ayman b. Muhriz from Muhammad b. al-Fudhayl from Abi Hamzah from Abi Abdillah who said: “None of our Shias gets up for prayer except that he is surrounded by angels equal to the number of enemies around him and they pray behind him and supplicate to Allah, the Mighty and the Sublime for him till he finishes his prayer.”

chapter: Chapter 98 | Reward of reciting Durood on Muhammad (s.a.w.s.) and his progeny on Friday after Asr prayers
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنَا سَعْدُ بْنُ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِیسَی الْیَقْطِینِیِّ عَنْ زَکَرِیَّا الْمُؤْمِنِ عَنِ ابْنِ نَاجِیَهَ عَنْ دَاوُدَ بْنِ النُّعْمَانِ عَنْ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ سَیَابَهَ عَنْ نَاجِیَهَ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ ع إِذَا صَلَّیْتَ الْعَصْرَ یَوْمَ الْجُمُعَهِ فَقُلِ اللَّهُمَّ صَلِّ عَلَی مُحَمَّدٍ وَ آلِ مُحَمَّدٍ الْأَوْصِیَاءِ الْمَرْضِیِّینَ بِأَفْضَلِ صَلَوَاتِکَ وَ بَارِکْ عَلَیْهِمْ بِأَفْضَلِ بَرَکَاتِکَ وَ السَّلَامُ عَلَیْهِمْ وَ عَلَی أَرْوَاحِهِمْ وَ أَجْسَادِهِمْ وَ رَحْمَهُ اللَّهِ وَ بَرَکَاتُهُ- فَإِنَّ مَنْ قَالَهَا فِی دُبُرِ الْعَصْرِ کَتَبَ اللَّهُ لَهُ مِائَهَ أَلْفِ حَسَنَهٍ وَ مَحَا اللَّهُ عَنْهُ مِائَهَ أَلْفِ سَیِّئَهٍ وَ قَضَی لَهُ بِهَا مِائَهَ أَلْفِ حَاجَهٍ وَ رَفَعَ لَهُ بِهَا مِائَهَ أَلْفِ دَرَجَهٍ.
hadees_english: 1. Imam Muhammad Baqir says, “After you pray the Asr prayers on Friday recite as follows: Allaahumma s’alli a’laa muh’ammadinw wa aali muh’ammadin alaa aus’iyaa-il mursaleena bi-afz”ali s’alawaatika wa baarik wa baarika a’laihim bi-afz”ali barakaatika was salaamu a’laihim wa a’laa arwaah’ihim wa ajsaamidihim wa rah’matullaahi wa barakaatuh. For one who recites this after Asr, Allah writes for him a hundred thousand rewards, wipes out a hundred thousand sins. Fulfills a hundred thousand wishes of him and increases his position by a hundred thousand levels.”

chapter: Chapter 99 | Reward of reciting Surah Hamd, Surah Tauheed and Muawwazatain seven times, Ayatal Kursi, Ayat-e-Sakhr and the last verse of Surah Baraat
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی سَعْدُ بْنُ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنِ ابْنِ الْمُغِیرَهِ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ بَعْدَ الْجُمُعَهِ حِینَ یَنْصَرِفُ الْحَمْدَ مَرَّهً وَ قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَدٌ سَبْعاً وَ قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ الْفَلَقِ سَبْعاً وَ قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ النَّاسِ سَبْعاً وَ آیَهَ الْکُرْسِیِّ وَ آیَهَ السُّخْرَهِ وَ آخِرَ بَرَاءَهَ لَقَدْ جاءَکُمْ رَسُولٌ مِنْ أَنْفُسِکُمْ إِلَی آخِرِهَا کَانَتْ لَهُ کَفَّارَهُ مَا بَیْنَ الْجُمُعَهِ إِلَی الْجُمُعَهِ.
hadees_english: 1. My father said: it was narrated to me by Sa’d b. Abdillah from Ahmad b. Muhammad from his father from Ibn al-Mughira from Abi Abdillah who said: “One who recites after the conclusion of Friday Prayer, Surah Hamd once, Surah Tauheed, Surah Qul a-oo’dhu birabbil falaq and Surah Qul a-oo’dhu birabbinnaas seven times and Ayatal Kursi, Ayat-e- Sakhr and the last verse of Surah Baraat once it would be a compensation of his sins from that Friday to next.”

chapter: Chapter 100 | One more reward of above recitations
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی عَلِیُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِیمَ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنِ النَّوْفَلِیِّ عَنِ السَّکُونِیِّ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ آبَائِهِ ع قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ص مَنْ قَرَأَ دُبُرَ صَلَاهِ الْجُمُعَهِ فَاتِحَهَ الْکِتَابِ مَرَّهً وَ قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَدٌ سَبْعَ مَرَّاتٍ وَ فَاتِحَهَ الْکِتَابِ مَرَّهً وَ قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ الْفَلَقِ سَبْعَ مَرَّاتٍ وَ فَاتِحَهَ الْکِتَابِ مَرَّهً وَ قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ النَّاسِ سَبْعَ مَرَّاتٍ لَمْ یَنْزِلْ بِهِ بَلِیَّهٌ وَ لَمْ تُصِبْهُ فِتْنَهٌ إِلَی الْجُمُعَهِ الْآخَرِ فَإِنْ قَالَ اللَّهُمَّ اجْعَلْنِی مِنْ أَهْلِ الْجَنَّهِ الَّتِی حَشْوُهَا بَرَکَهٌ وَ عُمَّارُهَا الْمَلَائِکَهُ مَعَ نَبِیِّنَا مُحَمَّدٍ وَ أَبِینَا إِبْرَاهِیمَ جَمَعَ اللَّهُ بَیْنَهُ وَ بَیْنَ مُحَمَّدٍ وَ إِبْرَاهِیمَ ع فِی دَارِ السَّلَامِ.
hadees_english: 1. Imam Muhammad Baqir narrates that the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) said, “One who recites after the conclusion of Friday Prayer, Surah Hamd once, Surah Qul a-oo’dhubirabbil falaq seven times, then Surah Hamd once and Surah Qul huwallaahu ah’ad seven times, then Surah Hamd once and Surah Qul a-oo’dhubirabbin Naas, no calamity would befall him and he won’t be involved in any mischief. Further if he says: Allaahummaj a’lnee min ahlil jannatillatee h’ashwuhaa barakatunw wa u’mmaaruhal malaa-ikatu ma-a’ nabiyyeenaa muh’ammadinw wa abeenaa ibraaheem Allah would keep him in Daarus Salaam (Paradise) along with Muhammad (s.a.w.s.) and Ibrahim .”

chapter: Chapter 101 | Reward of walking towards Salaat and learning Quran
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ إِدْرِیسَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ السِّنْدِیِّ عَنْ عَلِیِّ بْنِ الْحَکَمِ عَنْ سَیْفِ بْنِ عَمِیرَهَ عَنْ سَعْدِ بْنِ ظَرِیفٍ عَنِ الْأَصْبَغِ بْنِ نُبَاتَهَ قَالَ قَالَ أَمِیرُ الْمُؤْمِنِینَ ع إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ لَیَهُمُّ بِعَذَابِ أَهْلِ الْأَرْضِ جَمِیعاً حَتَّی لَا یُحَاشِیَ مِنْهُمْ أَحَداً إِذَا عَمِلُوا بِالْمَعَاصِی وَ اجْتَرَحُوا السَّیِّئَاتِ فَإِذَا نَظَرَ إِلَی الشِّیبِ نَاقِلِی أَقْدَامِهِمْ إِلَی الصَّلَاهِ وَ الْوِلْدَانِ یَتَعَلَّمُونَ الْقُرْآنَ رَحِمَهُمْ فَأَخَّرَ ذَلِکَ عَنْهُمْ.
hadees_english: 1. Amirul Momineen says, “Whenever people of the earth commit sins or get involved in wrong deeds, the Almighty Allah intends to send down His chastisement on the people of the world. However when He sees elderly people walking towards Salaat and young children learning Quran, He feels pity on them and postpones it.”

chapter: Chapter 102 | Reward of a patient person, blind and lover of Ahle Bayt
hadees_arabic: notfound
hadees_english: 1. Imam Muhammad Baqir says, “One who is patient and blind and hopeful of divine rewards and is a lover of the progeny of Muhammad (s.a.w.s.) there would be no accounting of deeds for him.”

hadees_arabic: notfound
hadees_english: 2. It is narrated that Allah does not take away one or both the eyes of a person except that He frees that person from being questioned about sins.

chapter: Chapter 103 | Reward of offering a two rakat recommended prayer, giving a dirham as Sadaqah and fasting for a day
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی الْحُسَیْنُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ أَبَانٍ عَنِ الْحُسَیْنِ بْنِ سَعِیدٍ عَنْ فَضَالَهَ عَنْ مُعَاوِیَهَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ إِسْمَاعِیلَ بْنِ یَسَارٍ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع یَقُولُ إِیَّاکُمْ وَ الْکَسَلَ إِنَّ رَبَّکُمْ رَحِیمٌ یَشْکُرُ الْقَلِیلَ إِنَّ الرَّجُلَ لَیُصَلِّی الرَّکْعَتَیْنِ تَطَوُّعاً یُرِیدُ بِهِمَا وَجْهَ اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ فَیُدْخِلُهُ اللَّهُ بِهِمَا الْجَنَّهَ وَ إِنَّهُ لَیَتَصَدَّقُ بِالدِّرْهَمِ تَطَوُّعاً یُرِیدُ بِهِ وَجْهَ اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ فَیُدْخِلُهُ اللَّهُ بِهِ الْجَنَّهَ وَ إِنَّهُ لَیَصُومُ الْیَوْمَ تَطَوُّعاً یُرِیدُ بِهِ وَجْهَ اللَّهِ تَعَالَی فَیُدْخِلُهُ بِهِ الْجَنَّهَ.
hadees_english: 1. The narrator says that he heard Imam Ja’far Sadiq say, “Leave laziness aside for your Lord is Merciful. He considers even a small deed of yours. A person who offers even a two rakat Salaat for the pleasure of Allah, He will make him enter Paradise for that. One who gives one dirham as Sadaqah seeking the pleasure of Allah, He would make him enter Paradise for that. One who fasts for a single day seeking the pleasure of Allah, He would make him enter Paradise for that.”

chapter: Chapter 104 | Excellence of the Fridays of the month of Ramadan over ordinary Fridays
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی سَعْدُ بْنُ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ النَّضْرِ الْخَزَّازِ عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ شِمْرٍ عَنْ جَابِرٍ قَالَ کَانَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ ع یَقُولُ إِنَّ لِجَمِیعِ شَهْرِ رَمَضَانَ لَفَضْلًا عَلَی جَمِیعِ سَائِرِ الشُّهُورِ کَفَضْلِ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ ص عَلَی سَائِرِ الرُّسُلِ.
hadees_english: 1. Imam Muhammad Baqir says, “Surely, the excellence of the Fridays of the month of Ramadan over ordinary Fridays is like the excellence of the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) over other prophets. Similar is the excellence of the month of Ramadan over all months.”

chapter: Chapter 105 | Reward of Praying with perfume
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی عَلِیُّ بْنُ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ جَدِّهِ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنِ الْمُفَضَّلِ بْنِ عُمَرَ عَنِ الصَّادِقِ ع قَالَ: رَکْعَتَانِ یُصَلِّیهِمَا مُتَعَطِّرٌ أَفْضَلُ مِنْ سَبْعِینَ رَکْعَهً یُصَلِّیهِمَا غَیْرُ مُتَعَطِّرٍ.
hadees_english: 1. It was narrated to me by Ali b. Ahmad from his grandfather Ahmad b. Abdillah from his father from Muhammad b. Khalid from al-Muffadhal b. Umar from al-Sadiq who said: “Two rakat prayer prayed with perfume is equal to seventy rakat prayer offered without perfume.”

chapter: Chapter 106 | Reward of Prayers of a married man
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی سَعْدُ بْنُ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِیٍّ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ حَکِیمٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ الْحَمِیدِ عَنِ الْوَلِیدِ بْنِ صَبِیحٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: رَکْعَتَیْنِ یُصَلِّیهِمَا مُتَزَوِّجٌ أَفْضَلُ مِنْ سَبْعِینَ رَکْعَهً یُصَلِّیهِمَا غَیْرُ مُتَزَوِّجٍ.
hadees_english: 1. My father said: it was narrated to me by Sa’d b. Abdillah from Ahmad b. Muhammad from al-Hassan b. Ali from Ja’far b. Muhammad b. Hakeem from Abdul-Hameed from al-Waleed b. Sabeeh from Abi Abdillah who said: “Two rakat Salaat of a married person is equal to seventy rakats of an unmarried person.”

chapter: Chapter 107 | Reward of a four rakat prayer reciting Surah Tauheed fifty times in each rakat
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ الصَّفَّارُ عَنِ الْعَبَّاسِ بْنِ مَعْرُوفٍ عَنْ سَعْدَانَ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ سَمِعْتُهُ یَقُولُ مَنْ صَلَّی أَرْبَعَ رَکَعَاتٍ یَقْرَأُ فِی کُلِّ رَکْعَهٍ بِ قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَدٌ خَمْسِینَ مَرَّهً لَمْ یَنْفَتِلْ بَیْنَهُ وَ بَیْنَ اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ ذَنْبٌ إِلَّا غَفَرَ لَهُ.
hadees_english: 1. The narrator says that he heard Imam Ja’far Sadiq say, “One who offers a four rakat prayer reciting Surah Tauheed fifty times in each rakat all of his sins committed between him and Allah, the Mighty and Sublime, would be forgiven before he concludes it.”

chapter: Chapter 108 | Reward of Salaat-e-Ja’far bin Abi Talib
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی سَعْدُ بْنُ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ عَلِیِّ بْنِ أَسْبَاطٍ عَنْ إِبْرَاهِیمَ بْنِ أَبِی الْبِلَادِ قَالَ: قُلْتُ لِأَبِی الْحَسَنِ ع أَیُّ شَیْ ءٍ لِمَنْ صَلَّی صَلَاهَ جَعْفَرٍ قَالَ لَوْ کَانَ عَلَیْهِ مِثْلُ رَمْلِ عَالِجٍ وَ زَبَدِ الْبَحْرِ ذُنُوباً لَغَفَرَهَا اللَّهُ لَهُ قُلْتُ هَذِهِ لَنَا قَالَ فَلِمَنْ هِیَ إِلَّا لَکُمْ خَاصَّهً قَالَ قُلْتُ فَأَیَّ شَیْ ءٍ یَقْرَأُ فِیهَا مِنْ عَرْضِ الْقُرْآنِ قَالَ لَا اقْرَأْ فِیهَا إِذا زُلْزِلَتِ وَ إِذا جاءَ نَصْرُ اللَّهِ وَ إِنَّا أَنْزَلْناهُ فِی لَیْلَهِ الْقَدْرِ وَ قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَدٌ.
hadees_english: 1. My father said: it was narrated to me by Sa’d b. Abdillah from his father from Ali b. Asbat from Ibrahim b. Abi al-Balad who said: The narrator asked Imam Musa Kadhim , “What is the reward of offering Salaat-e-Ja’far-e-Tayyar?” Imam replied, “Allah would forgive that person even if his sins are equal to the number of grains of sand or number of waves in the oceans.” The narrator asked, “Is this reward applicable for us?” Imam replied, “Of course, then for whom else? It is for you only.” The narrator asked, “Which Surah should be recited in this Salaat?” Imam replied, “Recite Idhaa zulzilat, idhaa jaa-a nas’rullaah, innaa anzalnaahu fee lailatil qadr and qul huwallaahu ah’ad.”

chapter: Chapter 109 | Reward of Salaat-e-Shab
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ الصَّفَّارُ عَنِ الْعَبَّاسِ بْنِ مَعْرُوفٍ عَنْ سَعْدَانَ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: شَرَفُ الْمُؤْمِنِ صَلَاهُ اللَّیْلِ وَ عِزُّ الْمُؤْمِنِ کَفُّهُ عَنِ النَّاسِ.
hadees_english: 1. It was narrated to me by Muhammad b. al-Hassan who said it was narrated to me by Muhammad b. al-Hassan al-Saffar from al-Abbas b. Ma’ruf from Sa’dan b. Muslim from Abdillah b. Sinan from Abi Abdillah who said: “The honor of a believer is in offering Salaat-e-Shab and his prestige is in not asking from people.”

hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ یَحْیَی الْعَطَّارُ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَحْمَدَ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی أَبُو زُهَیْرٍ النَّهْدِیُّ عَنْ آدَمَ بْنِ إِسْحَاقَ عَنْ مُعَاوِیَهَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِهِ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: عَلَیْکُمْ بِصَلَاهِ اللَّیْلِ فَإِنَّهَا سُنَّهُ نَبِیِّکُمْ وَ دَأْبُ الصَّالِحِینَ قَبْلَکُمْ وَ مَطْرَدَهُ الدَّاءِ عَنْ أَجْسَادِکُمْ.
hadees_english: 2. My father said: it was narrated to me by Muhammad b. Yahya al-’Attar who said it was narrated to me by Muhammad b. Ahmad who said it was narrated to me by Abu Zuhayr al-Hindi from Adam b. Ishaq from Muawiyah b. Ammar from some of his companions from Abi Abdillah who said: “Offer Salaat-e-Shab for it is the Sunnah of Muhammad (s.a.w.s.) and the virtuous that came before you. It removes all the ailments from your body.”

hadees_arabic: وَ بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع صَلَاهُ اللَّیْلِ تُبَیِّضُ الْوُجُوهَ وَ صَلَاهُ اللَّیْلِ تُطَیِّبُ الرِّیحَ وَ صَلَاهُ اللَّیْلِ تَجْلِبُ الرِّزْقَ.
hadees_english: 3. Imam Ja’far Sadiq says, “Salaat-e-Shab brightens the face. It imparts a sweet smell and increase in earnings.”

title: Thawāb al-Aʿmāl wa ʿiqāb al-Aʿmāl

chapter: Chapter 109 | Reward of Salaat-e-Shab
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ عُمَرَ بْنِ عَلِیِّ بْنِ عُمَرَ عَمَّنْ حَدَّثَهُ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: إِنْ کَانَ اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ قَدْ قَالَ- الْمالُ وَ الْبَنُونَ زِینَهُ الْحَیاهِ الدُّنْیا إِنَّ الثَّمَانَ رَکَعَاتٍ الَّتِی یُصَلِّیهَا الْعَبْدُ آخِرَ اللَّیْلِ زِینَهُ الْآخِرَهِ.
hadees_english: 4. It was narrated to me by Ahmad b. Muhammad from his father from Muhammad b. Ahmad from Umar b. Ali b. Umar from the one the person that narrated to him from Abi Abdillah who said: ‘Wealth and children are the adornment of life’, surely the eight rakat prayer offered in the last part of night is the adornment of the Hereafter.”

chapter: Chapter 109 | Reward of Salaat-e-Shab
hadees_arabic: وَ بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع أَنَّهُ جَاءَهُ رَجُلٌ فَشَکَا إِلَیْهِ الْحَاجَهَ فَأَفْرَطَ فِی الشِّکَایَهِ حَتَّی کَادَ أَنْ یَشْکُوَ الْجُوعَ فَقَالَ لَهُ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع یَا هَذَا أَ تُصَلِّی بِاللَّیْلِ قَالَ فَقَالَ الرَّجُلُ نَعَمْ قَالَ فَالْتَفَتَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع إِلَی صَاحِبِهِ فَقَالَ کَذَبَ مَنْ زَعَمَ أَنَّهُ یُصَلِّی بِاللَّیْلِ وَ یَجُوعُ بِالنَّهَارِ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ ضَمِنَ بِصَلَاهِ اللَّیْلِ قُوتَ النَّهَارِ.
hadees_english: 5. It is narrated from Imam Ja’far Sadiq that a person came to him and expressed his wish. He was about to complain of his starvation when Imam asked him, “Do you offer Salaat-e-Shab?” He said, “Yes.” Imam turned to him and said, “He is a liar that claims to offer Salaat-e-Shab and says that he has to starve during the day, because the Almighty Allah has guaranteed the sustenance of the day in the Salaat-e-Shab.”

hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی سَعْدُ بْنُ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِیسَی عَنِ الْقَاسِمِ بْنِ یَحْیَی عَنْ جَدِّهِ الْحُسَیْنِ بْنِ رَاشِدٍ عَنْ أَبِی بَصِیرٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی أَبِی عَنْ جَدِّهِ عَنْ آبَائِهِ عَنْ عَلِیِّ بْنِ أَبِی طَالِبٍ ع قَالَ: قِیَامُ اللَّیْلِ مَصَحَّهٌ لِلْبَدَنِ وَ رِضَاءُ الرَّبِّ وَ تَمَسُّکٌ بِأَخْلَاقِ النَّبِیِّینَ وَ تَعَرُّضٌ لِرَحْمَهِ اللَّهِ تَعَالَی.
hadees_english: 6. My father said: it was narrated to me by Sa’d b. Abdillah from Muhammad b. Isa from al-Qasim b. Yahya from his grandfather al-Hussain b. Rashid from Abi Basir from Abi Abdillah who said it was narrated to me by Abi from his grandfather from his forefathers from Ali b. Abi Talib who said: “Salaat-e-Shab is related to the safety of body, pleasure of Lord, character of the prophets and it attracts the Mercy of Allah.”

hadees_english: 7. The narrator says, “I heard him say that if one gets up at night after turning to his left and right in such a state that his chin is touching his chest (out of tiredness), Allah orders the doors of heavens to be opened and says to His angels: ‘Look at this servant of Mine. He is going to perform what is not even obligatory for him. He can expect three things from Me – that I forgive all his sins, I give him a chance to repent once again and increase his earnings. I hold you all angels as witness that I would grant all these things to him’.”

chapter: Chapter 109 | Reward of Salaat-e-Shab
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی الْحَسَنُ بْنُ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ أَبِیهِ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَحْمَدَ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِیِّ بْنِ عُثْمَانَ وَ أَبُو عُثْمَانَ اسْمُهُ عَبْدُ الْوَاحِدِ بْنُ حَبِیبٍ قَالَ زَعَمَ لَنَا مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَبِی حَمْزَهَ الثُّمَالِیُّ عَنْ مُعَاوِیَهَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ الدُّهْنِیِّ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: صَلَاهُ اللَّیْلِ تُحَسِّنُ الْوَجْهَ وَ تُحَسِّنُ الْخُلُقَ وَ تُطَیِّبُ الرِّیحَ وَ تُدِرُّ الرِّزْقَ وَ تَقْضِی الدَّیْنَ وَ تَذْهَبُ بِالْهَمِّ وَ تَجْلُو الْبَصَرَ.
hadees_english: 8. It was narrated to me by al-Hassan b. Ahmad from his father who said it was narrated to me by Muhammad b. Ahmad who said it was narrated to me by Muhammad b. Abdillah from Ahmad b. al-Hassan b. Ali b. Uthman and Abu Uthman his name is Abd al-Wahid b. Habeeb who said claimed to us Muhammad b. Abi Hamzah al-Thumali from Muawiyah b. Ammar al-Duhni from Abi Abdillah who said: “Salaat-e-Shab beautifies one’s face, improves one’s character, fragrances the body and increases earnings. It helps in repayment of debts, removal of sorrows and improves eyesight.”

chapter: Chapter 109 | Reward of Salaat-e-Shab
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ یَحْیَی عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِیَادٍ عَنْ هَارُونَ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ عَلِیِّ بْنِ الْحَکَمِ عَنِ الْحُسَیْنِ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ الْکِنْدِیِّ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: إِنَّ الرَّجُلَ لَیَکْذِبُ الْکَذِبَهَ فَیُحْرَمُ بِهَا رِزْقَهُ قُلْتُ وَ کَیْفَ یُحْرَمُ رِزْقَهُ فَقَالَ یُحْرَمُ بِهَا صَلَاهَ اللَّیْلِ فَإِذَا حُرِمَ صَلَاهَ اللَّیْلِ حُرِمَ الرِّزْقَ.
hadees_english: 9. It was narrated to me by Muhammad b. al-Hassan who said it was narrated to me by Muhammad b. Yahya from Muhammad b. Ahmad from Sahl b. Ziyad from Harun b. Muslim from Ali b. al-Hakam from al-Hussain b. al-Hassan al-Kindi from Abi Abdillah who said: “It is possible that a person lies and is deprived of his sustenance.” The narrator asked, “How can he be deprived of his sustenance?” Imam replied, “By getting deprived from Salaat-e-Shab. One who is deprived of Salaat-e-Shab is (also) deprived of his sustenance.”

hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ الْحِمْیَرِیُّ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ جَمِیلٍ عَنْ فُضَیْلٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: إِنَّ الْبُیُوتَ الَّتِی یُصَلَّی فِیهَا بِاللَّیْلِ بِتِلَاوَهِ الْقُرْآنِ تُضِی ءُ لِأَهْلِ السَّمَاءِ کَمَا تُضِی ءُ نُجُومُ السَّمَاءِ لِأَهْلِ الْأَرْضِ.
hadees_english: 10. My father said: it was narrated to me by Abdillah b. Ja’far al-Himyari from Ahmad b. Muhammad from al-Hassan b. Mahbub from Jameel from Fudhayl from Abi Abdillah who said: “The houses, in which the Holy Quran is recited along with Salaat-e-Shab appear bright to the people of heaven in the same way as stars appear to the people of the world.”

hadees_english: 11. Imam Ja’far Sadiq explains the statement of Allah that ‘Good deeds destroy sins’ by saying, “The Salaat offered by a believer at night destroys the sins committed by him during the day.”
