chapter: Chapter 159 | Reward of one who memorizes the Holy Quran and one who obeys its commandments
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی الْحُسَیْنُ بْنُ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ جَمِیلِ بْنِ صَالِحٍ عَنِ الْفَضْلِ بْنِ یَسَارٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: الْحَافِظُ لِلْقُرْآنِ وَ الْعَامِلُ بِهِ مَعَ السَّفَرَهِ الْکِرَامِ الْبَرَرَهِ.
hadees_english: 1. It was narrated to me by al-Hussain b. Ahmad from his father from Ahmad b. Muhammad from al-Hassan b. Mahbub from Jameel b. Salih from al-Fadhl b. Yasar from Abi Abdillah who said: “A person who memorizes the Holy Quran and obeys its commandments is in the group of senior angels.”

chapter: Chapter 160 | Difficulty in memorizing the Holy Quran and reciting a Surah before going to bed
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی عَلِیُّ بْنُ الْحُسَیْنِ الْمُکَتِّبُ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ أَبِیهِ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ جَعْفَرٍ الْحِمْیَرِیِّ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ جَمِیلِ بْنِ صَالِحٍ عَنِ الْفُضَیْلِ بْنِ یَسَارٍ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع یَقُولُ إِنَّ الَّذِی یُعَالِجُ الْقُرْآنَ لِیَحْفَظَهُ بِمَشَقَّهٍ مِنْهُ وَ قِلَّهِ حِفْظٍ لَهُ أَجْرَانِ وَ قَالَ مَا یَمْنَعُ التَّاجِرَ مِنْکُمُ الْمَشْغُولَ فِی سُوقِهِ إِذَا رَجَعَ إِلَی مَنْزِلِهِ أَنْ لَا یَنَامَ حَتَّی یَقْرَأَ سُورَهً مِنَ الْقُرْآنِ فَیُکْتَبَ لَهُ مَکَانَ کُلِّ آیَهٍ یَقْرَؤُهَا عَشْرُ حَسَنَاتٍ وَ یُمْحَی عَنْهُ عَشْرُ سَیِّئَاتٍ.
hadees_english: 1. Imam Ja’far Sadiq said, “One who tries to memorize the Holy Quran with extreme difficulty due to a weak memory will get two rewards.” He further said, “Why don’t the people who trade in markets whole day not recite a Surah when they return to their homes at night before going to bed? If they do so they would get ten rewards for each verse and ten sins will be wiped off.”

chapter: Chapter 161 | Reward of a one who comes and goes
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنَا سَعْدُ بْنُ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ الْبَرْقِیِّ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی الْحُسَیْنُ بْنُ یَزِیدَ النَّوْفَلِیُّ عَنِ السَّکُونِیِّ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ قَالَ: قِیلَ یَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ أَیُّ الرِّجَالِ خَیْرٌ قَالَ الْحَالُّ الْمُرْتَحِلُ قِیلَ یَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ وَ مَا الْحَالُّ الْمُرْتَحِلُ قَالَ الْفَاتِحُ الْخَاتِمُ الَّذِی یَفْتَحُ الْقُرْآنَ وَ یَخْتِمُهُ فَلَهُ عِنْدَ اللَّهِ دَعْوَهٌ مُسْتَجَابَهٌ.
hadees_english: 1. My father said: it was narrated to us by Sa’d b. Abdillah from Ahmad b. Abi Abdillah al-Barqi who said it was narrated to me by al-Hussain b. Yazid al-Nawfali from al-Sakuni from Abi Abdillah who said: Imam Ja’far Sadiq says that the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) was asked, “Who is the best of men?” The Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) replied, “One who comes and goes.” He was again asked, “What is meant by one who comes and goes?” He replied, “One who starts and ends. One who starts reciting the Holy Quran and ends it. There is no one nearer to Allah than him and his supplications are accepted.”

chapter: Chapter 162 | Reward of reciter of the Holy Quran
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنَا مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُوسَی بْنِ الْمُتَوَکِّلِ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی عَلِیُّ بْنُ الْحُسَیْنِ السَّعْدَآبَادِیُّ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِیسَی بْنِ عُبَیْدٍ عَنْ سُلَیْمَانَ بْنِ رَاشِدٍ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ مُعَاوِیَهَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع مَنْ قَرَأَ الْقُرْآنَ فَهُوَ غَنِیٌّ وَ لَا فَقْرَ بَعْدَهُ وَ الأمانه [إِلَّا مَا بِهِ] غِنًی.
hadees_english: 1. Imam Ja’far Sadiq says, “The reciter of the Holy Quran is rich; there is no misery for him and one who does not recite the Holy Quran is not rich.”

chapter: Chapter 163 | Reward of reciting the Holy Quran by looking at it
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ الصَّفَّارُ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ یَعْقُوبَ بْنِ یَزِیدَ عَنْ رَجُلٍ مِنَ الْعَوَامِّ رَفَعَهُ إِلَی أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ فِی الْمُصْحَفِ نَظَراً مُتِّعَ بِبَصَرِهِ وَ خُفِّفَ عَنْ وَالِدَیْهِ وَ إِنْ کَانَا کَافِرَیْنِ.
hadees_english: 1. It was narrated to me by Muhammad b. al-Hassan who said it was narrated to me by Muhammad b. al-Hassan al-Saffar from Ahmad b. Abdillah from Ya’qub b. Yazid from a man from the general populace who raised it to Abi Abdillah who said: “One who recites the Holy Quran by looking at it, his eyes will become stronger and the chastisement of his parents would be reduced even if they had been disbelievers.”

chapter: Chapter 163 | Reward of reciting the Holy Quran by looking at it
hadees_arabic: وَ بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ رَفَعَهُ إِلَی النَّبِیِّ ص قَالَ: لَیْسَ شَیْ ءٌ أَشَدَّ عَلَی الشَّیْطَانِ مِنْ قِرَاءَهِ الْمُصْحَفِ نَظَراً.
hadees_english: 2. And from the previous chain who raised it to The Prophet (s.a.w.s.) who said: “There is nothing more severe for Satan except a person reciting the Holy Quran by looking at it.”

chapter: Chapter 164 | Reward of keeping the Holy Quran at one’s home
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنَا عَلِیُّ بْنُ الْحُسَیْنِ السَّعْدَآبَادِیُّ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ الْبَرْقِیِّ عَنْ عَلِیِّ بْنِ الْحُسَیْنِ الصَّیْرَفِیِّ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عِیسَی عَنْ جَعْفَرٍ عَنْ أَبِیهِ ع قَالَ: إِنِّی لَیُعْجِبُنِی أَنْ یَکُونَ فِی الْبَیْتِ مُصْحَفٌ لا یَطْرُدُ اللَّهُ بِهِ الشَّیْطَانَ.
hadees_english: 1. My father said: it was narrated to us by Ali b. al-Hussain al-Sa’dabadi from Ahmad b. Abi Abdillah al-Barqi from Ali b. al-Hussain al-Sayrafi from Hamad b. Isa from Ja’far from his father who said: “I like keeping the Holy Quran at home. Allah keeps Satan away from the house because of it.”

chapter: Chapter 165 | Reward of reciting ten to one thousand verses during a night
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ الصَّفَّارُ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِیسَی عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ سَعِیدٍ عَنِ النَّضْرِ بْنِ سُوَیْدٍ عَنْ یَحْیَی الْحَلَبِیِّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مَرْوَانَ عَنْ سَعِیدِ بْنِ ظَرِیفٍ عَنْ أَبِی جَعْفَرٍ ع قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ص مَنْ قَرَأَ عَشْرَ آیَاتٍ فِی لَیْلَهٍ لَمْ یُکْتَبْ مِنَ الْغَافِلِینَ وَ مَنْ قَرَأَ خَمْسِینَ آیَهً کُتِبَ مِنَ الذَّاکِرِینَ وَ مَنْ قَرَأَ مِائَهَ آیَهٍ کُتِبَ مِنَ الْقَانِتِینَ وَ مَنْ قَرَأَ مِائَتَیْ آیَهٍ کُتِبَ مِنَ الْخَاشِعِینَ وَ مَنْ قَرَأَ ثَلَاثَمِائَهِ آیَهٍ کُتِبَ مِنَ الْفَائِزِینَ وَ مَنْ قَرَأَ خَمْسَمِائَهِ آیَهٍ کُتِبَ مِنَ الْمُجْتَهِدِینَ وَ [مَنْ] قَرَأَ أَلْفَ آیَهٍ کُتِبَ لَهُ قِنْطَاراً وَ الْقِنْطَارُ خَمْسُمِائَهِ أَلْفِ مِثْقَالِ ذَهَبٍ وَ الْمِثْقَالُ أَرْبَعَهٌ وَ عِشْرُونَ قِیرَاطاً أَصْغَرُهَا مِثْلُ جَبَلِ أُحُدٍ وَ أَکْبَرُهَا مَا بَیْنَ السَّمَاءِ وَ الْأَرْضِ.
hadees_english: 1. Imam Muhammad Baqir says that the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) said, “One who recites ten verses of the Holy Quran at night won’t be included among the ignorant ones. One who recites fifty verses would be included among those who remember Allah much. One who recites a hundred verses would be included among those who perform Qunoot. One who recites two hundred verses would be included among Khashi-in (most humble). One who recites three hundred verses would be included among successful people. One who recites five hundred verses would be included among Mujtahideen (Holy warriors). One who recites a thousand verses would get the reward of one Qintar and a single Qintar is worth fifteen thousand Mithqal gold and a single Mithqal comprises of twenty-four Qirat and the smallest Qirat is equal to Mount Ohad and the biggest Qirat is equal to the distance between the earth and the heaven.”

chapter: Chapter 166 | Reward of the best season of the Holy Quran
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی عَلِیُّ بْنُ الْحُسَیْنِ السَّعْدَآبَادِیُّ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ النَّضْرِ عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ شِمْرٍ عَنْ جَابِرٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع أَنَّهُ قَالَ: لِکُلِّ شَیْ ءٍ رَبِیعٌ وَ رَبِیعُ الْقُرْآنِ شَهْرُ رَمَضَانَ.
hadees_english: 1. My father said: it was narrated to me by Ali b. al-Hussain al-Sa’dabadi from Ahmad b. al-Nadhr from ’Amru b. Shimr from Jabir from Abi Abdillah that he said: “There is a best season for everything and the best season of reciting the Holy Quran is the month of Ramadan.”

chapter: Chapter 167 | Reward of reciting a hundred verses of the Holy Quran and saying Yaa Allaah seven times
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عَلِیِّ بْنِ مَاجِیلَوَیْهِ عَنْ عَمِّهِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِی الْقَاسِمِ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ عَلِیِّ بْنِ أَسْبَاطٍ یَرْفَعُهُ إِلَی أَمِیرِ الْمُؤْمِنِینَ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ مِائَهَ آیَهٍ مِنَ الْقُرْآنِ مِنْ أَیِّ الْقُرْآنِ شَاءَ ثُمَّ قَالَ یَا اللَّهُ سَبْعَ مَرَّاتٍ فَلَوْ دَعَا عَلَی الصَّخْرَهِ لَقَلَعَهَا إِنْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ.
hadees_english: 1. It was narrated to me by Muhammad b. Ali b. Majluwayh from his uncle Muhammad b. Abi al-Qasim from Ahmad b. Abi Abdillah from Ali b. Asbat who raised it to Ameer al-Mumineen who said: “One who says Yaa Allaah seven times after reciting a hundred verses of the Holy Quran from anywhere, even if he prays against Sakhr (a stone) it would be dislodged from its place.”

chapter: Chapter 168 | Reward of reciting Surah Hamd
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ یَحْیَی الْعَطَّارُ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ حَسَّانَ عَنْ إِسْمَاعِیلَ بْنِ مِهْرَانَ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی الْحَسَنُ بْنُ عَلِیِّ بْنِ أَبِی حَمْزَهَ الْبَطَائِنِیُّ عَنْ أَبِیهِ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع اسْمُ اللَّهِ الْأَعْظَمُ مُقَطَّعٌ فِی أُمِّ الْکِتَابِ.
hadees_english: 1. Imam Ja’far Sadiq says, “The Greatest Name of Allah is in Ummul Kitab (source of the book) i.e. Surah Hamd.”

chapter: Chapter 169 | Reward of reciting Surah Baqarah and Surah Aale Imran
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِدْرِیسَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ حَسَّانَ عَنْ إِسْمَاعِیلَ بْنِ مِهْرَانَ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِیٍّ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنِ الْحُسَیْنِ بْنِ أَبِی الْعَلَاءِ عَنْ أَبِی بَصِیرٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ الْبَقَرَهَ وَ آلَ عِمْرَانَ جَاءَ یَوْمَ الْقِیَامَهِ تُظِلَّانِهِ عَلَی رَأْسِهِ مِثْلَ الْغَمَامَتَیْنِ أَوْ مِثْلَ الْغَیَابَتَیْنِ.
hadees_english: 1. It was narrated to me by Muhammad b. al-Hassan who said it was narrated to me by Muhammad b. Idris from Muhammad b. Ahmad b. Muhammad b. Ahmad from Ismail b. Mihran from al-Hassan b. Ali from his father from al-Hussain b. Abi al-’Ala from Abi Basir from Abi Abdillah who said: “One who recites Surah Baqarah and Surah Aale Imran, these Surahs will cover him like a cloud on the Day of Judgment.”

chapter: Chapter 170 | Reward of reciting the first four verses of Surah Baqarah, Ayatal Kursi and two verses which follow it and the last three verses of this Surah
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عَلِیِّ بْنِ مَاجِیلَوَیْهِ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ یَحْیَی الْعَطَّارُ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ الْحُسَیْنِ اللُّؤْلُؤِیِّ عَنْ مُعَاذٍ عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ جُمَیْعٍ رَفَعَهُ إِلَی عَلِیِّ بْنِ الْحُسَیْنِ ع قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ص مَنْ قَرَأَ أَرْبَعَ آیَاتٍ مِنْ أَوَّلِ الْبَقَرَهِ وَ آیَهَ الْکُرْسِیِّ وَ آیَتَیْنِ بَعْدَهَا وَ ثَلَاثَ آیَاتٍ مِنْ آخِرِهَا لَمْ یَرَ فِی نَفْسِهِ وَ مَالِهِ شَیْئاً یَکْرَهُهُ وَ لَا یَقْرَبُهُ شَیْطَانٌ وَ لَا یَنْسَی الْقُرْآنَ.
hadees_english: 1. Imam Zainul Abideen narrates that the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) said, “One who recites the first four verses of Surah Baqarah, Ayatal Kursi and two verses which follow it and the last three verses of this Surah he and his wealth would remain safe from all calamities. Satan would not come near him and he will never forget the Holy Quran.”

chapter: Chapter 171 | Reward of reciting Ayatal Kursi after every Salaat and before going to bed
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ الصَّفَّارُ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ الْجَهْمِ عَنْ إِبْرَاهِیمَ بْنِ مِهْزَمٍ عَنْ رَجُلٍ سَمِعَ أَبَا الْحَسَنِ الرِّضَا ع یَقُولُ مَنْ قَرَأَ آیَهَ الْکُرْسِیِّ عِنْدَ مَنَامِهِ لَمْ یَخَفِ الْفَالِجَ إِنْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ وَ مَنْ قَرَأَهَا بَعْدَ کُلِّ صَلَاهٍ لَمْ یَضُرَّهُ ذُو حُمَهٍ.
hadees_english: 1. It is narrated that Imam Ridha said, “One who recites Ayatal Kursi before going to bed would remain safe of Paralysis and one recites it after every Salaat no poison would harm him.”

chapter: Chapter 172 | Reward of reciting Surah Nisa every Friday
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُوسَی بْنِ الْمُتَوَکِّلِ قَالَ حَدَّثَنَا مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ یَحْیَی عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ حَسَّانَ عَنْ إِسْمَاعِیلَ بْنِ مِهْرَانَ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِیٍّ عَنْ عَلِیِّ بْنِ عَابِسٍ عَنْ أَبِی مَرْیَمَ عَنِ الْمِنْهَالِ عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ زِرِّ بْنِ حُبَیْشٍ عَنْ أَمِیرِ الْمُؤْمِنِینَ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ النِّسَاءِ فِی کُلِّ جُمُعَهٍ أُومِنَ مِنْ ضَغْطَهِ الْقَبْرِ.
hadees_english: 1. Amirul Momineen Ali Ibne Abi Talib says, “One who recites Surah Nisa every Friday would remain safe from the squeeze of the grave.”

chapter: Chapter 173 | Reward of reciting Surah Maidah
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ یَحْیَی عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ حَسَّانَ عَنْ إِسْمَاعِیلَ بْنِ مِهْرَانَ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِیٍّ عَنْ أَبِی مَسْعُودٍ الْمَدَائِنِیِّ عَنْ أَبِی الْجَارُودِ عَنْ أَبِی جَعْفَرٍ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ الْمَائِدَهِ فِی کُلِّ یَوْمِ خَمِیسٍ لَمْ یَلْتَبِسْ إِیمَانُهُ بِظُلْمٍ وَ لَمْ یُشْرِکْ بِهِ أَبَداً.
hadees_english: 1. My father said: it was narrated to me by Muhammad b. Yahya from Muhammad b. Ahmad from Ismail b. Mihran from al-Hassan b. Ali from Abi Mas’ud al-Madaini from Abi al-Jarud from Abi Ja’far who said: “One who recites Surah Maidah every Thursday, his faith will never wear the clothes of injustice and he would never commit polytheism.”

chapter: Chapter 174 | Reward of reciting Surah Anaam
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَبِی الْقَاسِمِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَلِیٍّ الْکُوفِیِّ عَنْ إِسْمَاعِیلَ بْنِ مِهْرَانَ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِیٍّ عَنْ عَلِیِّ بْنِ الْحُسَیْنِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ فَرْقَدٍ عَنِ الْحَکَمِ بْنِ ظُهَیْرٍ عَنْ أَبِی صَالِحٍ عَنِ ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ الْأَنْعَامِ فِی کُلِّ لَیْلَهٍ کَانَ مِنَ الْآمِنِینَ یَوْمَ الْقِیَامَهِ وَ لَمْ یَرَ بِعَیْنِهِ النَّارَ أَبَداً-
hadees_english: 1. My father said: it was narrated to me by Muhammad b. Abi al-Qasim from Muhammad b. Ali al-Kufi from Ismail b. Mihran from al-Hassan b. Ali from Ali b. al-Hussain b. Muhammad b. Farqad from al-Hakam b. Dhahir from Abi Salih from Ibn Abbas who said: It is narrated from Ibne Abbas that one who recites Surah Anaam every night would remain safe on the Day of Judgment and would never see the fire of Hell.

chapter: Chapter 174 | Reward of reciting Surah Anaam
hadees_arabic: وَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع نَزَلَتْ سُورَهُ الْأَنْعَامِ جُمْلَهً وَاحِدَهً شَیَّعَهَا سَبْعُونَ أَلْفَ مَلَکٍ حَتَّی نَزَلَتْ عَلَی مُحَمَّدٍ ص فَعَظِّمُوهَا وَ بَجِّلُوهَا فَإِنَّ اسْمَ اللَّهِ فِیهَا فِی سَبْعِینَ مَوْضِعاً وَ لَوْ عَلِمَ النَّاسُ مَا فِیهَا مَا تَرَکُوهَا.
hadees_english: 2. Imam Ja’far Sadiq says, “Surah Anaam was revealed whole at once. Seventy thousand angels kept watch on it when it was revealed on Muhammad (s.a.w.s.). Hence it should be regarded as an honored Surah and must be respected. If people had known what is there in it they would have never ignored it.”

chapter: Chapter 175 | Reward of reciting Surah Araaf
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِیٍّ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ أَبِی بَصِیرٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ الْأَعْرَافِ فِی کُلِّ شَهْرٍ کَانَ یَوْمَ الْقِیَامَهِ مِنَ الَّذِینَ لا خَوْفٌ عَلَیْهِمْ وَ لا هُمْ یَحْزَنُونَ فَإِنْ قَرَأَهَا فِی کُلِّ جُمُعَهٍ کَانَ مِمَّنْ لَا یُحَاسَبُ یَوْمَ الْقِیَامَهِ أَمَا إِنَّ فِیهَا مُحْکَماً فَلَا تَدَعُوا قِرَاءَتَهَا فَإِنَّهَا تَشْهَدُ یَوْمَ الْقِیَامَهِ لِمَنْ قَرَأَهَا.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan b. Ali from his father from Abi Basir from Abi Abdillah who said: “One who recites Surah Araaf once every month would be included among those for whom there is no fear or sorrow on the Day of Judgment. One who recites it every Friday would be included among those for whom there is no accounting on the Day of Judgment. Know that one of the Muhkamat (clear verses) of the Holy Quran is present in this Surah and it will bear witness on the Day of Judgment for the reciter.”

chapter: Chapter 176 | Reward of reciting Surah Anfaal and Surah Taubah
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ أَبِی بَصِیرٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ الْأَنْفَالِ وَ سُورَهَ بَرَاءَهَ فِی کُلِّ شَهْرٍ لَمْ یَدْخُلْهُ نِفَاقٌ أَبَداً وَ کَانَ مِنْ شِیعَهِ أَمِیرِ الْمُؤْمِنِینَ ع.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from his father from Abi Basir from Abi Abdillah who said: “One who recites Surah Anfaal and Surah Taubah every month would never get involved in hypocrisy and would be among the Shias of Amirul Momineen .”

chapter: Chapter 177 | Reward of reciting Surah Yunus
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ الْحُسَیْنِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ فَرْقَدٍ عَنْ فضل [فُضَیْلٍ] الْغَسَّانِ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ یُونُسَ فِی کُلِّ شَهْرَیْنِ أَوْ ثَلَاثَهٍ لَمْ یُخَفْ عَلَیْهِ أَنْ یَکُونَ مِنَ الْجَاهِلِینَ وَ کَانَ یَوْمَ الْقِیَامَهِ مِنَ الْمُقَرَّبِینَ.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan b. al-Hussain b. Muhammad b. Farqad from Fadhl [Fudhayl] al-Ghassan from Abi Abdillah who said: “One who recites Surah Yunus every two to three months would never have fear that he is ignorant and he would be included among the near ones on the Day of Judgment.”

chapter: Chapter 178 | Reward of reciting Surah Hud
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ صَنْدَلٍ عَنْ کَثِیرِ بْنِ کَاثِرَهَ عَنْ فَرْوَهَ بْنِ الْآجُرِّیِّ عَنْ أَبِی جَعْفَرٍ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَلِیٍّ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ هُودٍ فِی کُلِّ جُمُعَهٍ بَعَثَهُ اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ یَوْمَ الْقِیَامَهِ فِی زُمْرَهِ النَّبِیِّینَ وَ لَمْ یُعْرَفْ لَهُ خَطِیئَهٌ عَمِلَهَا یَوْمَ الْقِیَامَهِ.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from Sandal from Katheer b. Kathira from Farwa b. al-Ajuri from Abi Ja’far Muhammad b. Ali who said: Imam Muhammad Baqir , “One who recites Surah Hud every Friday, the Almighty Lord would gather him along with the group of prophets on the Day of Judgment and he would be considered sinless on that day.”

chapter: Chapter 179 | Reward of reciting Surah Yusuf
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ أَبِی بَصِیرٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ یُوسُفَ ع فِی کُلِّ یَوْمٍ أَوْ فِی کُلِّ لَیْلَهٍ بَعَثَهُ اللَّهُ تَعَالَی یَوْمَ الْقِیَامَهِ وَ جَمَالُهُ مِثْلُ جَمَالِ یُوسُفَ ع وَ لَا یُصِیبُهُ فَزَعٌ یَوْمَ الْقِیَامَهِ وَ کَانَ مِنْ خِیَارِ عِبَادِ اللَّهِ الصَّالِحِینَ وَ قَالَ إِنَّهَا کَانَتْ فِی التَّوْرَاهِ مَکْتُوبَهً.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from his father from Abi Basir from Abi Abdillah who said: “One who recites Surah Yusuf every day or night, the Almighty Allah would resurrect him on the Day of Judgment in a form as handsome as Yusuf . He won’t have any fear on the Day of Judgment and he would be among the virtuous servants of Allah. This Surah was revealed in the Old Testament also.”

chapter: Chapter 180 | Reward of reciting Surah Raad
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنِ الْحُسَیْنِ بْنِ أَبِی الْعَلَاءِ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع أَنَّهُ قَالَ: مَنْ أَکْثَرَ قِرَاءَهَ سُورَهِ الرَّعْدِ لَمْ یُصِبْهُ اللَّهُ بِصَاعِقَهٍ أَبَداً وَ لَوْ کَانَ نَاصِبِیّاً وَ إِذَا کَانَ مُؤْمِناً أُدْخِلَ الْجَنَّهَ بِلَا حِسَابٍ وَ یُشَفَّعُ فِی جَمِیعِ مَنْ یَعْرِفُهُ مِنْ أَهْلِ بَیْتِهِ وَ إِخْوَانِهِ.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from al-Hussain b. Abi al-’Ala from Abi Abdillah that he said: “One who recites Surah Raad excessively, the Almighty Allah would never let him get struck by lightning even if that person is the enemy of Ahle Bayt . If he is a believer He would make him enter Paradise and if he does intercession for his relatives and friends it would be accepted from him.”

chapter: Chapter 181 | Reward of reciting Surah Ibrahim and Surah Hijr
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ أَبِی الْمَغْرَاءِ عَنْ عَنْبَسَهَ بْنِ مُصْعَبٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ إِبْرَاهِیمَ وَ الْحِجْرِ فِی رَکْعَتَیْنِ جَمِیعاً فِی کُلِّ جُمُعَهٍ لَمْ یُصِبْهُ فَقْرٌ أَبَداً وَ لَا جُنُونٌ وَ لَا بَلْوَی.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from Abi al-Maghraa’ from ’Anbasa b. Mus’ab from Abi Abdillah who said: “One who recites Surah Ibrahim and Surah Hijr in two rakats on Friday would never get involved in poverty, insanity and calamity.”

chapter: Chapter 182 | Reward of reciting Surah Nahl
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ عَاصِمٍ الْخَیَّاطِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِی جَعْفَرٍ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ النَّحْلِ فِی کُلِّ شَهْرٍ کُفِیَ الْمَغْرَمَ فِی الدُّنْیَا وَ سَبْعِینَ نَوْعاً مِنْ أَنْوَاعِ الْبَلَایَا أَهْوَنُهُ الْجُنُونُ وَ الْجُذَامُ وَ الْبَرَصُ وَ کَانَ مَسْکَنُهُ فِی جَنَّهِ عَدْنٍ وَ هِیَ وَسَطُ الْجِنَانِ.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from ’Asim al-Khayyat from Muhammad b. Muslim from Abi Ja’far who said: “One who recites Surah Nahl every month would not see harm in the world and would be immune from seventy diseases the least of whom are insanity, leprosy and white spots. And his destination would be Jannat-e-Adn inside Paradise.”

chapter: Chapter 183 | Reward of reciting Surah Bani Israel
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنِ الْحُسَیْنِ بْنِ أَبِی الْعَلَاءِ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَا مِنْ عَبْدٍ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ بَنِی إِسْرَائِیلَ فِی کُلِّ لَیْلَهِ جُمُعَهٍ لَمْ یَمُتْ حَتَّی یُدْرِکَ الْقَائِمَ ع وَ یَکُونَ مِنْ أَصْحَابِهِ.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from al-Hussain b. Abi al-’Ala from Abi Abdillah who said: “One who recites Surah Bani Israel every Thursday night won’t die until he meets Qaim (a.t.f.s.) and becomes one of his companions.”

chapter: Chapter 184 | Reward of reciting Surah Kahf
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی أَبِی عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ هِلَالٍ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ جَدِّهِ عَنْ أَمِیرِ الْمُؤْمِنِینَ ع یَقُولُ مَا مِنْ عَبْدٍ یَقْرَأُ قُلْ إِنَّما أَنَا بَشَرٌ مِثْلُکُمْ إِلَی آخِرِ السُّورَهِ إِلَّا کَانَ لَهُ نُوراً مِنْ مَضْجَعِهِ إِلَی بَیْتِ اللَّهِ الْحَرَامِ فَإِنَّ مَنْ کَانَ لَهُ نُورٌ فِی بَیْتِ اللَّهِ الْحَرَامِ کَانَ لَهُ نُورٌ إِلَی بَیْتِ الْمَقْدِسِ.
hadees_english: 1. Amirul Momineen said, “One who recites from Qul innamaa anaa basharum mithlukum till the end of this Surah, the Almighty Allah would create a light from his bed till the Holy Kaaba and if that person is from Mecca the light would be created from his bed till Baitul Muqaddas.”

chapter: Chapter 184 | Reward of reciting Surah Kahf
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُوسَی بْنِ الْمُتَوَکِّلِ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ یَحْیَی قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ حَسَّانَ عَنْ إِسْمَاعِیلَ بْنِ مِهْرَانَ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی الْحَسَنُ بْنُ عَلِیٍّ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ الْکَهْفِ کُلَ لَیْلَهِ جُمُعَهٍ لَمْ یَمُتْ إِلَّا شَهِیداً أَوْ یَبْعَثُهُ اللَّهُ مِنَ الشُّهَدَاءِ وَ وَقَفَ یَوْمَ الْقِیَامَهِ مَعَ الشُّهَدَاءِ.
hadees_english: 2. It was narrated to me by Muhammad b. Musa b. al-Mutawakil who said it was narrated to me by Muhammad b. Yahya who said it was narrated to me by Muhammad b. Ahmad from Muhammad b. Ahmad from Ismail b. Mihran who said it was narrated to me by al-Hassan b. Ali from his father from Abi Abdillah who said: “One who recites Surah Kahf every Friday would die the death of a martyr and he would be resurrected along with martyrs and would accompany martyrs on the Day of Judgment.”

chapter: Chapter 185 | Reward of reciting Surah Maryam
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ عُمَرَ عَنْ أَبَانٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ أَدْمَنَ قِرَاءَهَ سُورَهِ مَرْیَمَ لَمْ یَمُتْ حَتَّی یُصِیبَ مَا یُغْنِیهِ فِی نَفْسِهِ وَ مَالِهِ وَ وُلْدِهِ وَ کَانَ فِی الْآخِرَهِ مِنْ أَصْحَابِ عِیسَی ابْنِ مَرْیَمَ ع وَ أُعْطِیَ فِی الْآخِرَهِ مِثْلَ مُلْکِ سُلَیْمَانَ بْنِ دَاوُدَ ع فِی الدُّنْیَا.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from Umar from Aban from Abi Abdillah who said: One who recites Surah Maryam regularly will not die till he is given that which makes him needless in himself, wealth and children; and in the hereafter he would be of the companions of Isa and in the hereafter he would be given a like of the worldly kingdom of Sulaiman bin Dawood .

chapter: Chapter 186 | Reward of reciting Surah Taha
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ صَبَّاحٍ الْحَذَّاءِ عَنْ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: لَا تَدَعُوا قِرَاءَهَ سُورَهِ طه فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ یُحِبُّهَا وَ یُحِبُّ مَنْ قَرَأَهَا وَ مَنْ أَدْمَنَ قِرَاءَتَهَا أَعْطَاهُ اللَّهُ یَوْمَ الْقِیَامَهِ کِتابَهُ بِیَمِینِهِ* وَ لَمْ یُحَاسِبْهُ بِمَا عَمِلَ فِی الْإِسْلَامِ وَ أُعْطِیَ فِی الْآخِرَهِ مِنَ الْأَجْرِ حَتَّی یَرْضَی.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from Sabah al-Hadha from Ishaq b. Ammar from Abi Abdillah who said: “Don’t miss the recitation of Surah Taha because Allah loves that Surah and its reciters. If a person recites it regularly, the Almighty Allah would give him scroll of deeds in his right hand on the Day of Judgment. There would be no accounting for his deeds, which he had done after accepting Islam and he would get so many rewards in the hereafter that he would be pleased.”

chapter: Chapter 187 | Reward of reciting Surah Anbiya
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ یَحْیَی بْنِ مُسَاوِرٍ عَنْ فُضَیْلٍ الْغَسَّانِ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ الْأَنْبِیَاءِ حُبّاً لَهَا کَانَ کَمَنْ رَافَقَ النَّبِیِّینَ أَجْمَعِینَ فِی جَنَّاتِ النَّعِیمِ وَ کَانَ مَهِیباً فِی أَعْیُنِ النَّاسِ حَیَاهَ الدُّنْیَا.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from Yahya b. Musawir from Fudhayl al-Ghassan from Abi Abdillah who said: One who recites Surah Anbiya with sincerity to it, would be among the companions of all the prophets in Paradise. While in the world he would carry much prestige and awe among the people.

chapter: Chapter 188 | Reard of reciting Surah al-Hajj
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِیِّ بْنِ سَوْرَهَ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ الْحَجِّ فِی کُلِّ ثَلَاثَهِ أَیَّامٍ لَمْ تَخْرُجْ سَنَتُهُ حَتَّی یَخْرُجَ إِلَی بَیْتِ اللَّهِ الْحَرَامِ وَ إِنْ مَاتَ فِی سَفَرِهِ دَخَلَ الْجَنَّهَ قُلْتُ فَإِنْ کَانَ مُخَالِفاً قَالَ یُخَفَّفُ عَنْهُ بَعْضُ مَا هُوَ فِیهِ.
hadees_english: 1 - In this chain of narration, from Al-Hasan ibn Ali ibn Suraqa, from his father, from Abu Abdullah (Imam Ja'far al-Sadiq ), he said: "Whoever recites Surah Al-Hajj every three days, his age will not end until he goes to the Sacred House of Allah (Kaaba), and if he dies during his journey, he will enter paradise." I asked, "What if he is unable to do so?" He replied, "Some of the difficulty will be alleviated for him."

chapter: Chapter 189 | Reward of reciting Surah Mominoon
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ الْحُسَیْنِ بْنِ أَبِی الْعَلَاءِ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ الْمُؤْمِنِینَ خَتَمَ اللَّهُ لَهُ بِالسَّعَادَهِ وَ إِذَا کَانَ مُدْمِنَ قِرَاءَتِهَا فِی کُلِّ جُمُعَهٍ کَانَ مَنْزِلُهُ فِی الْفِرْدَوْسِ الْأَعْلَی مَعَ النَّبِیِّینَ وَ الْمُرْسَلِینَ.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan b. al-Hussain b. Abi al-’Ala from Abi Abdillah who said: Whoever recites Surah Mominoon, Allah completes for him the greatness of virtues and auspiciousness and if someone recites Surah Mominoon every Friday regularly, his position would be in the high garden of Paradise where he would be with the prophets and messengers.

chapter: Chapter 190 | Reward of reciting Surah Nur
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ الْمُؤْمِنِ عَنِ ابْنِ مُسْکَانَ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: حَصِّنُوا أَمْوَالَکُمْ وَ فُرُوجَکُمْ بِتِلَاوَهِ سُورَهِ النُّورِ وَ حَصِّنُوا بِهَا نِسَاءَکُمْ قَالَ مَنْ أَدْمَنَ قِرَاءَتَهَا فِی کُلِّ یَوْمٍ أَوْ فِی کُلِّ لَیْلَهٍ لَمْ یَزْنِ أَحَدٌ مِنْ أَهْلِ بَیْتِهِ أَبَداً حَتَّی یَمُوتَ فَإِذَا هُوَ مَاتَ شَیَّعَهُ إِلَی قَبْرِهِ سَبْعُونَ أَلْفَ مَلَکٍ کُلُّهُمْ یَدْعُونَ وَ یَسْتَغْفِرُونَ اللَّهَ لَهُ حَتَّی یُدْخَلَ فِی قَبْرِهِ.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from Abi Abdillah al-Mu’min from Ibn Muskan from Abi Abdillah who said: “Safeguard your wealth, life and women with recitation of Surah Nur. One who recites it regularly everyday or every night none from his family will fall into trouble till he or she dies. When he dies 70000 angels would accompany his bier upto the grave and all those angels would keep praying for him and seeking forgiveness for him till the reciter is laid down in the grave.”

chapter: Chapter 191 | Reward of reciting Surah Furqan
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ سَیْفِ بْنِ عَمِیرَهَ عَنْ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِی الْحَسَنِ ع قَالَ: یَا ابْنَ عَمَّارٍ لَا تَدَعْ قِرَاءَهَ سُورَهِ تَبارَکَ الَّذِی نَزَّلَ الْفُرْقانَ عَلی عَبْدِهِ فَإِنَّ مَنْ قَرَأَهَا فِی کُلِّ لَیْلَهٍ لَمْ یُعَذِّبْهُ اللَّهُ أَبَداً وَ لَمْ یُحَاسِبْهُ وَ کَانَ مَنْزِلُهُ فِی الْفِرْدَوْسِ الْأَعْلَی.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from Sayf b. ’Umayra from Ishaq b. Ammar from Abi al-Hassan who said: “O Ibne Ammar! Do not avoid recitation of Tabaarakalladhee nazzalal furqaana a’laa a’bdihi. One who recites it every night, Allah will never chastise him and not take his account and his abode will be in the high garden of Paradise.”

chapter: Chapter 192 | Reward of reciting Surah Naml, Shuara and Qasas
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنِ الْحُسَیْنِ بْنِ أَبِی الْعَلَاءِ عَنْ أَبِی بَصِیرٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ الطَّوَاسِینَ الثَّلَاثَهِ فِی لَیْلَهِ الْجُمُعَهِ کَانَ مِنْ أَوْلِیَاءِ اللَّهِ وَ فِی جِوَارِ اللَّهِ وَ کَنَفِهِ وَ لَمْ یُصِبْهُ فِی الدُّنْیَا بُؤْسٌ أَبَداً وَ أُعْطِیَ فِی الْآخِرَهِ مِنَ الْجَنَّهِ حَتَّی یَرْضَی وَ فَوْقَ رِضَاهُ وَ زَوَّجَهُ اللَّهُ مِائَهَ زَوْجَهٍ مِنْ حُورِ الْعِینِ.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from al-Hussain b. Abi al-’Ala from Abi Basir from Abi Abdillah who said: “One who recites Surah Tawaseen (Surah Naml, Shuara and Qasas) every Friday eve would be included among the lovers of Allah. He would remain in the protection of Allah. He would never fall prey to helplessness and would get Paradise much more than he desired. The Almighty Allah would marry him to more than one hundred Hoorul Ein.”

chapter: Chapter 193 | Reward of reciting Surah Ankaboot and Room
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ أَبِی بَصِیرٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ الْعَنْکَبُوتِ وَ الرُّومِ فِی شَهْرِ رَمَضَانَ لَیْلَهَ ثَلَاثَهٍ وَ عِشْرِینَ فَهُوَ وَ اللَّهِ یَا أَبَا مُحَمَّدٍ مِنْ أَهْلِ الْجَنَّهِ لَا أَسْتَثْنِی فِیهِ أَبَداً وَ لَا أَخَافُ أَنْ یَکْتُبَ اللَّهُ عَلَیَّ فِی یَمِینِی إِثْماً وَ إِنَّ لِهَاتَیْنِ السُّورَتَیْنِ مِنَ اللَّهِ مَکَاناً.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from his father from Abi Basir from Abi Abdillah who said: “O Aba Muhammad! One who recites Surah Ankaboot and Room on the twenty-third of the month of Ramadan would be included among the people of Paradise. I do not expect anything. Allah would not write any sins of this type. These two Surahs have a high regard near Allah.”

chapter: Chapter 194 | Reward of reciting Surah Luqman
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ جُبَیْرٍ الْعَرْزَمِیِّ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ أَبِی جَعْفَرٍ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ لُقْمَانَ فِی کُلِّ لَیْلَهٍ وَکَّلَ اللَّهُ بِهِ فِی لَیْلَتِهِ مَلَائِکَهً یَحْفَظُونَهُ مِنْ إِبْلِیسَ وَ جُنُودِهِ حَتَّی یُصْبِحَ فَإِذَا قَرَأَهَا بِالنَّهَارِ لَمْ یَزَالُوا یَحْفَظُونَهُ مِنْ إِبْلِیسَ وَ جُنُودِهِ حَتَّی یُمْسِیَ.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from ’Amru b. Jubayr al-’Arzami from his father from Abi Ja’far who said: One who recites Surah Luqman every night, Allah appoints for him angels that protect him from Iblees and his army till the morning. If he recites it in the day, they will not leave him and protect him from Iblees and his army till the night falls.

chapter: Chapter 195 | Reward of reciting Surah Sajdah
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنِ الْحُسَیْنِ بْنِ أَبِی الْعَلَاءِ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ السَّجْدَهِ فِی کُلِّ لَیْلَهِ جُمُعَهٍ أَعْطَاهُ اللَّهُ کِتابَهُ بِیَمِینِهِ* وَ لَمْ یُحَاسِبْهُ بِمَا کَانَ مِنْهُ وَ کَانَ مِنْ رُفَقَاءِ مُحَمَّدٍ وَ أَهْلِ بَیْتِهِ ص.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from al-Hussain b. Abi al-’Ala from Abi Abdillah who said: “One who recites it on Friday eve, Allah would bestow him His scroll of deeds in his right hand, and account will not be taken of what he had done, and he will be of the companions of Muhammad and his Ahle Bayt .”

chapter: Chapter 196 | Reward of reciting Surah Ahzaab
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ کَانَ کَثِیرَ الْقِرَاءَهِ لِسُورَهِ الْأَحْزَابِ کَانَ یَوْمَ الْقِیَامَهِ فِی جِوَارِ مُحَمَّدٍ ص وَ أَزْوَاجِهِ ثُمَّ قَالَ سُورَهُ الْأَحْزَابِ فِیهَا فَضَائِحُ الرِّجَالِ وَ النِّسَاءِ مِنْ قُرَیْشٍ وَ غَیْرِهِمْ یَا ابْنَ سِنَانٍ إِنَّ سُورَهَ الْأَحْزَابِ فَضَحَتْ نِسَاءَ قُرَیْشٍ مِنَ الْعَرَبِ وَ کَانَتْ أَطْوَلَ مِنْ سُورَهِ الْبَقَرَهِ وَ لَکِنْ نَقَصُوهَا وَ حَرَّفُوهَا.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from Abdillah b. Sinan from Abi Abdillah who said: “One who recites Surah Ahzaab extensively would remain in the neighborhood of Muhammad ﷺ and his wives. Some men and women of Quraish and non-Quraish are disgraced in Surah Ahzaab. O Ibne Sinaan! It is this Surah that exposed some women of Quraish.”

chapter: Chapter 197 | Reward of reciting Surah Saba and Fatir
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ عَائِذٍ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِی أُذَیْنَهَ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: الحمدین [لِلْحَمْدَیْنِ] جَمِیعاً حَمْدِ سَبَإٍ وَ حَمْدِ فَاطِرٍ مَنْ قَرَأَهُمَا فِی لَیْلَهٍ لَمْ یَزَلْ فِی لَیْلَتِهِ فِی حِفْظِ اللَّهِ وَ کِلَاءَتِهِ فَمَنْ قَرَأَهُمَا فِی نَهَارِهِ لَمْ یُصِبْهُ فِی نَهَارِهِ مَکْرُوهٌ وَ أُعْطِیَ مِنْ خَیْرِ الدُّنْیَا وَ خَیْرِ الْآخِرَهِ مَا لَمْ یَخْطُرْ عَلَی قَلْبِهِ وَ لَمْ یَبْلُغْ مُنَاهُ.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from Ahmad b. ’Aidh from Ibn Abi Adheena from Abi Abdillah who said: “One who recites Surah Saba and Surah Fatir at night; Allah would protect him that night and if he recites them during the day he would not face any sort of undesirable thing that day. Allah would grant him so much goodness in this world and the hereafter that he would have never imagined or desired.”

chapter: Chapter 198 | Reward of reciting Surah Yasin
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنِ الْحُسَیْنِ بْنِ أَبِی الْعَلَاءِ عَنْ أَبِی نَصْرٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: إِنَّ لِکُلِّ شَیْ ءٍ قَلْباً وَ إِنَّ قَلْبَ الْقُرْآنِ یس وَ مَنْ قَرَأَهَا قَبْلَ أَنْ یَنَامَ أَوْ فِی نَهَارِهِ قَبْلَ أَنْ یَمْشِیَ کَانَ فِی نَهَارِهِ مِنَ الْمَحْفُوظِینَ وَ الْمَرْزُوقِینَ حَتَّی یُمْسِیَ وَ مَنْ قَرَأَهَا فِی لَیْلِهِ قَبْلَ أَنْ یَنَامَ وَکَّلَ اللَّهُ بِهِ أَلْفَ مَلَکٍ یَحْفَظُونَهُ مِنْ شَرِّ کُلِّ شَیْطَانٍ رَجِیمٍ وَ مِنْ کُلِّ آفَهٍ وَ إِنْ مَاتَ فِی یَوْمِهِ أَدْخَلَهُ اللَّهُ الْجَنَّهَ وَ حَضَرَ غُسْلَهُ ثَلَاثُونَ أَلْفَ مَلَکٍ کُلُّهُمْ یَسْتَغْفِرُونَ لَهُ وَ یُشَیِّعُونَهُ إِلَی قَبْرِهِ بِالاسْتِغْفَارِ لَهُ فَإِذَا دَخَلَ فِی لَحْدِهِ کَانُوا فِی جَوْفِ قَبْرِهِ یَعْبُدُونَ اللَّهَ وَ ثَوَابُ عِبَادَتِهِمْ لَهُ وَ فُسِّحَ لَهُ فِی قَبْرِهِ مَدَّ بَصَرِهِ وَ أُومِنَ مِنْ ضَغْطَهِ الْقَبْرِ وَ لَمْ یَزَلْ لَهُ فِی قَبْرِهِ نُورٌ سَاطِعٌ إِلَی عَنَانِ السَّمَاءِ إِلَی أَنْ یُخْرِجَهُ اللَّهُ مِنْ قَبْرِهِ فَإِذَا أَخْرَجَهُ لَمْ تَزَلْ مَلَائِکَهُ اللَّهِ یُشَیِّعُونَهُ وَ یُحَدِّثُونَهُ وَ یَضْحَکُونَ فِی وَجْهِهِ وَ یُبَشِّرُونَهُ بِکُلِّ خَیْرٍ حَتَّی یُجَوِّزُونَهُ عَلَی الصِّرَاطِ وَ الْمِیزَانِ وَ یُوقِفُونَهُ مِنَ اللَّهِ مَوْقِفاً لَا یَکُونُ عِنْدَ اللَّهِ خَلْقاً أَقْرَبَ مِنْهُ إِلَّا مَلَائِکَهُ اللَّهِ الْمُقَرَّبُونَ وَ أَنْبِیَاؤُهُ الْمُرْسَلُونَ وَ هُوَ مَعَ النَّبِیِّینَ وَاقِفٌ بَیْنَ یَدَیِ اللَّهِ لَا یَحْزَنُ مَعَ مَنْ یَحْزَنُ وَ لَا یَهُمُّ مَعَ مَنْ یَهُمُّ وَ لَا یَجْزَعُ مَعَ مَنْ یَجْزَعُ- ثُمَّ یَقُولُ لَهُ الرَّبُّ تَبَارَکَ وَ تَعَالَی اشْفَعْ عَبْدِی أُشَفِّعْکَ فِی جَمِیعِ مَا تَشْفَعُ وَ سَلْنِی أُعْطِکَ عَبْدِی جَمِیعَ مَا تَسْأَلُ فَیَسْأَلُ فَیُعْطَی وَ یَشْفَعُ وَ لَا یُحَاسَبُ فِیمَنْ یُحَاسَبُ وَ لَا یُوقَفُ مَعَ مَنْ یُوقَفُ وَ لَا یَذِلُّ مَعَ مَنْ یَذِلُّ وَ لَا یُکْتَبُ بِخَطِیئَهٍ وَ لَا بِشَیْ ءٍ مِنْ سُوءِ عَمَلِهِ وَ یُعْطَی کِتَاباً مَنْشُوراً حَتَّی یَهْبِطَ مِنْ عِنْدِ اللَّهِ فَیَقُولُ النَّاسُ بِأَجْمَعِهِمْ سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ مَا کَانَ لِهَذَا الْعَبْدِ مِنْ خَطِیئَهٍ وَاحِدَهٍ وَ یَکُونُ مِنْ رُفَقَاءِ مُحَمَّدٍ ص.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from al-Hussain b. Abi al-’Ala from Abi Nasr from Abi Abdillah who said: “Indeed everything has a heart and the heart of Quran is Surah Yasin. One who recites it before going to bed or any part of the day would remain safe during that day and get earnings from Allah. One who recites it before going to bed at night; the Almighty Allah would appoint seventy angels to protect him from the mischief of Satan and all sorts of calamities. If he dies the next day Allah would make him enter Paradise and thirty thousand angels would be present at the time of ritual bath of his dead body. They would repent for him and pray for his forgiveness and they would accompany him till his burial in the grave. Angels would enter the grave before he is laid down in it and worship over there and the reward of this worship would be given to him. His grave would be expanded for a distance as further as an eye can see. He would remain safe from squeeze of the grave and an illuminated light would emerge from his grave till the heaven. This light would remain till the time Allah takes him out of his grave. When he would be resurrected from his grave, he would be speaking to angels, his face would be happy and they would give him good news at every stage till they pass through the Sirat Bridge and Mizan. The angels would take him so near to Allah that none except the nearest angels and prophets have been there. He would stand in front of Allah with the prophets. While others will be sorrowful and troubled, he would have no sorrow, trouble or a difficulty. Allah would tell him, ‘Do intercession of whomsoever you want. I will accept your intercession and ask for whatever you want. I will grant you’. He will get whatever he desires and if he does intercession for a person it would be accepted while others would have to give account of their deeds. They would have been stopped and being disgraced but there would be no accounting for this person. No one will stop him and there would be no disgrace for him. He won’t face bad fortune for any of his deeds. His scroll of deeds would be opened and given to him. When he would come down after meeting Allah, people would utter Sub-h’aanallaah on seeing him. They would say, “There is no sin to the name of this servant and he will get the company of Muhammad (s.a.w.s.).”

title: Thawāb al-Aʿmāl wa ʿiqāb al-Aʿmāl
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
translator: Sayed Athar Husain Rizvi & Sayed Maqsood Athar
description: Thawāb al-Aʿmāl wa ʿIqāb al-Aʿmāl is a remarkable collection of Ḥadīths collected by al-Shaykh al-Ṣadūq, a preeminent Shīʿa scholar of the 4th/10th century. Thawāb al-Aʿmāl wa ʿIqāb al-Aʿmāl delineates virtuous and sinful deeds, elucidating their spiritual consequences which lead to either reward or punishment. It has long served as an invaluable resource for both Shīʿa scholars and the general Shīʿa population and is celebrated as one of the most notable Shīʿa Ḥadīth collections. The author's motivation for writing this book was rooted in the prophetic hadith: "The one who leads people to good deeds is as their doer." Shaykh al-Ṣadūq emphasised that his primary goal in authoring the book was to seek the reward and satisfaction of God. The book is structured into two primary parts. The first part, "Thawāb al-Aʿmāl," encompasses 788 Ḥadīths arranged under 389 titles, detailing the spiritual rewards for performing righteous actions. The second part, "ʿIqāb al-Aʿmāl," includes 331 Ḥadīths distributed under 131 titles, focusing on the punitive consequences of committing sinful actions.
chapter: Chapter 198 | Reward of reciting Surah Yasin
hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ الصَّفَّارُ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ أَبِی الْخَطَّابِ عَنْ عَلِیِّ بْنِ أَسْبَاطٍ عَنْ یَعْقُوبَ بْنِ سَالِمٍ عَنْ أَبِی الْحَسَنِ الْعَبْدِیِّ عَنْ جَابِرٍ الْجُعْفِیِّ عَنْ أَبِی جَعْفَرٍ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ یس فِی عُمُرِهِ مَرَّهً وَاحِدَهً کَتَبَ اللَّهُ لَهُ بِکُلِّ خَلْقٍ فِی الدُّنْیَا وَ بِکُلِّ خَلْقٍ فِی الْآخِرَهِ وَ فِی السَّمَاءِ وَ بِکُلِّ وَاحِدٍ أَلْفَیْ أَلْفِ حَسَنَهٍ وَ مَحَا عَنْهُ مِثْلَ ذَلِکَ وَ لَمْ یُصِبْهُ فَقْرٌ وَ لَا غُرْمٌ وَ لَا هَدْمٌ وَ لَا نَصَبٌ وَ لَا جُنُونٌ وَ لَا جُذَامٌ وَ لَا وَسْوَاسٌ وَ لَا دَاءٌ یَضُرُّهُ- وَ خَفَّفَ اللَّهُ عَنْهُ سَکَرَاتِ الْمَوْتِ وَ أَهْوَالَهُ وَ وَلِیَ قَبْضَ رُوحِهِ وَ کَانَ مِمَّنْ یَضْمَنُ اللَّهُ لَهُ السَّعَهَ فِی مَعِیشَتِهِ وَ الْفَرَجَ عِنْدَ لِقَائِهِ وَ الرِّضَا بِالثَّوَابِ فِی آخِرَتِهِ وَ قَالَ اللَّهُ تَعَالَی لِمَلَائِکَتِهِ أَجْمَعِینَ مَنْ فِی السَّمَاوَاتِ وَ مَنْ فِی الْأَرْضِ قَدْ رَضِیتُ عَنْ فُلَانٍ فَاسْتَغْفِرُوا لَهُ.
hadees_english: 2. It was narrated to me by Muhammad b. al-Hassan who said it was narrated to me by Muhammad b. al-Hassan al-Saffar from Muhammad b. al-Hassan b. Abi al-Khattab from Ali b. Asbat from Ya’qub b. Salim from Abi al-Hassan al-’Abdi from Jabir al-Ju’fi from Abi Ja’far who said: For one who recites Yasin once in his lifetime Allah writes for him virtues million times more than the number of Allah’s creatures that are in this world and would be in the heavens on the Day of Judgment, and the same number of his sins would be forgiven and that man would not be afflicted with poverty and sorrow: he would be safe from death by being buried under debris, misfortune, insanity and doubts and from every such illness that might give him pain, and Allah would make the pangs of death and its fear easy and light; and at the time of departure of the soul, Allah would be his Helper while for one whose helper is Allah there is generous livelihood in this world while in the next there would be happiness and pleasure before Allah and also a great reward. When he meets his Lord in the Hereafter, Allah would say to all the angels that exist in skies and the earth that I am happy and satisfied with such and such a man, so O angels, all of you seek forgiveness for this man.

chapter: Chapter 199 | Reward of reciting Surah Saffat
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی أَحْمَدُ بْنُ إِدْرِیسَ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ حَسَّانَ عَنْ إِسْمَاعِیلَ بْنِ مِهْرَانَ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ أَبِی الْعَلَاءِ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ الصَّافَّاتِ فِی کُلِّ یَوْمِ جُمُعَهٍ لَمْ یَزَلْ مَحْفُوظاً مِنْ کُلِّ آفَهٍ مَدْفُوعاً عَنْهُ کُلُّ بَلِیَّهٍ فِی الْحَیَاهِ الدُّنْیَا مَرْزُوقاً فِی الدُّنْیَا فِی أَوْسَعِ مَا یَکُونُ مِنَ الرِّزْقِ وَ لَمْ یُصِبْهُ اللَّهُ فِی مَالِهِ وَ وُلْدِهِ وَ لَا بَدَنِهِ بِسُوءٍ مِنْ شَیْطَانٍ رَجِیمٍ وَ لَا مِنْ جَبَّارٍ عَنِیدٍ وَ إِنْ مَاتَ فِی یَوْمِهِ أَوْ فِی لَیْلَتِهِ بَعَثَهُ اللَّهُ شَهِیداً وَ أَمَاتَهُ شَهِیداً وَ أَدْخَلَهُ الْجَنَّهَ مَعَ الشُّهَدَاءِ فِی دَرَجَهٍ مِنَ الْجَنَّهِ.
hadees_english: 1. My father said: it was narrated to me by Ahmad b. Idris who said it was narrated to me by Muhammad b. Ahmad from Muhammad b. Ahmad from Ismail b. Mihran from al-Hassan b. Abi al-’Ala from Abi Abdillah who said: One who recites Saffat every Friday would remain safe from every calamity, every trouble would remain away from him in his worldly life, there would be increase in his livelihood and he would not receive any harm for himself, his property and his children from any powerful enemy or the accursed Satan. If he dies the same day or the same night he would die as a martyr, Allah would raise him as a martyr (i.e. on the Day of Judgment he would be raised like martyrs) or give him the death of a martyr; and he would be admitted into Paradise in the high position of Martyrs.

chapter: Chapter 200 | Reward of reciting Surah Saad
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ جُبَیْرٍ الْعَرْزَمِیِّ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ أَبِی جَعْفَرٍ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ ص فِی لَیْلَهِ الْجُمُعَهِ أُعْطِیَ مِنْ خَیْرِ الدُّنْیَا وَ الْآخِرَهِ مَا لَمْ یُعْطَ أَحَدٌ مِنَ النَّاسِ إِلَّا نَبِیٌّ مُرْسَلٌ أَوْ مَلَکٌ مُقَرَّبٌ وَ أَدْخَلَهُ اللَّهُ الْجَنَّهَ وَ کُلَّ مَنْ أَحَبَّ مِنْ أَهْلِ بَیْتِهِ حَتَّی خَادِمَهُ الَّذِی یَخْدُمُهُ وَ إِنْ لَمْ یَکُنْ فِی حَدِّ عِیَالِهِ وَ لَا فِی حَدِّ مَنْ یَشْفَعُ فِیهِ.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from ’Amru b. Jubayr al-’Arzami from his father from Abi Ja’far who said: “One who recites Surah Saad every Friday eve would get goodness in this world and hereafter so much, which is not received by anyone except the prophets, messengers and nearest angels. Allah would make him and his family enter Paradise even if they are not among the ones whose intercession can be done by him.”

chapter: Chapter 201 | Reward of reciting Surah Zumar
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ صَنْدَلٍ عَنْ هَارُونَ بْنِ خَارِجَهَ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ الزُّمَرِ استحقها [اسْتَخَفَّهَا] مِنْ لِسَانِهِ أَعْطَاهُ اللَّهُ مِنْ شَرَفِ الدُّنْیَا وَ الْآخِرَهِ وَ أَعَزَّهُ بِلَا مَالٍ وَ لَا عَشِیرَهٍ حَتَّی یَهَابُهُ مَنْ یَرَاهُ وَ حَرَّمَ جَسَدَهُ عَلَی النَّارِ وَ بَنَی لَهُ فِی الْجَنَّهِ أَلْفَ مَدِینَهٍ فِی کُلِّ مَدِینَهٍ أَلْفُ قَصْرٍ فِی کُلِّ قَصْرٍ مِائَهُ حَوْرَاءَ وَ لَهُ مَعَ هَذَا عَیْنانِ تَجْرِیانِ وَ عَیْنانِ نَضَّاخَتانِ- وَ عَیْنَانِ مُدْهامَّتانِ وَ حُورٌ مَقْصُوراتٌ فِی الْخِیامِ- ذَواتا أَفْنانٍ وَ مِنْ کُلِّ فاکِهَهٍ زَوْجانِ
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from Sandal from Harun b. Kharija from Abi Abdillah who said: “One who recites Surah Zumar and considers it easy to recite, the Almighty Allah would grant him prestige in this world and hereafter and he would be honored even without possessing wealth or a good family background. He would grant him honor in front of everyone. Fire would be prohibited on his body. A thousand cities would be built for him in Paradise and every city will have one thousand palaces and every palace will have one hundred Hoorul Ein. He would make two normal springs flow, two springs flow under the trees and two more green springs to flow for him. He would veil all of the Hoorul Ein. He would grant numerous bounties and fruits, each fruit having two forms.”

chapter: Chapter 202 | Reward of reciting Surah Ha Mim Momin
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ جُوَیْرِیَهَ بْنِ أَبِی الْعَلَاءِ عَنْ أَبِی الصَّبَّاحِ عَنْ أَبِی جَعْفَرٍ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ حم الْمُؤْمِنَ فِی کُلِّ لَیْلَهٍ غَفَرَ اللَّهُ لَهُ مَا تَقَدَّمَ مِنْ ذَنْبِهِ وَ مَا تَأَخَّرَ وَ أَلْزَمَهُ کَلِمَهَ التَّقْوی وَ جَعَلَ الْآخِرَهَ خَیْراً لَهُ مِنَ الدُّنْیَا.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan b. Jawrawayh b. Abi al-’Ala from Abi al-Sabah from Abi Ja’far who said: “One who recites Ha Mim Momin every night, Allah forgives him all his past and future sins and makes compulsory for him the word of piety (that is he would be inclined to it) and makes the hereafter for him better than the world.”

chapter: Chapter 203 | Reward of reciting Surah Ha Mim Sajdah
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ أَبِی الْمَعْزَاءِ عَنْ ذَرِیحٍ الْمُحَارِبِیِّ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع مَنْ قَرَأَ حم السَّجْدَهَ کَانَتْ لَهُ نُوراً یَوْمَ الْقِیَامَهِ مَدَّ بَصَرِهِ وَ سُرُوراً وَ عَاشَ فِی الدُّنْیَا مَحْمُوداً مَغْبُوطاً.
hadees_english: 1. Imam Ja’far Sadiq said, “One who recites Surah Ha Mim Sajdah this Surah would be a cause of happiness for him on the Day of Judgment and it would provide him such a light, which will be present as long as an eye can see. He would have a good life in this world and would be loved by others.”

chapter: Chapter 204 | Surah Ha Mim Ain Seen Qaaf
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ سَیْفِ بْنِ عَمِیرَهَ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ حمعسق بَعَثَهُ اللَّهُ یَوْمَ الْقِیَامَهِ وَ وَجْهُهُ کَالثَّلْجِ أَوْ کَالشَّمْسِ حَتَّی یَقِفَ بَیْنَ یَدَیِ اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ فَیَقُولُ عَبْدِی أَدَمْتَ قِرَاءَهَ حمعسق وَ لَمْ تَدْرِ مَا ثَوَابُهَا أَمَا لَوْ دَرَیْتَ مَا هِیَ وَ مَا ثَوَابُهَا لَمَا طلت [مَلِلْتَ] قِرَاءَتَهَا وَ لَکِنْ سَأُجِیزُکَ جَزَاءَکَ أَدْخِلُوهُ الْجَنَّهَ وَ لَهُ فِیهَا قَصْرٌ مِنْ یَاقُوتَهٍ حَمْرَاءَ أَبْوَابُهَا وَ شُرَفُهَا وَ دَرَجُهَا مِنْهَا یُرَی ظَاهِرُهَا مِنْ بَاطِنِهَا وَ بَاطِنُهَا مِنْ ظَاهِرِهَا وَ أَلْفُ غُلَامٍ مِنَ الْوِلْدَانِ الْمُخَلَّدِینَ الَّذِینَ وَصَفَهُمُ اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from Sayf b. ’Umayra from Abi Abdillah who said: “One who recites “Surah Sajdah”, Allah will raise him on the Day of Judgment while his face would be like the snow (delighted) or like the sun till he would be presented before Allah, the Exalted and the Mighty: It will be said to him: My servant, you had regularly recited the “Surah Sajdah” and you did not know its reward. If you knew what it is and what is its reward you would not be shortcoming in reciting it; and I will soon give your reward. O Angels make him enter Paradise and in it will be a palace of red rubies, and its doors and turrets arches. He will see its inside from the outside and its outside from its inside and a thousand pageboys born there and living there, whom Allah, the Exalted and the Mighty, had selected.”

chapter: Chapter 205 | Reward of reciting Surah Zukhruf
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ أَبِی الْمِعْزَی عَنْ أَبِی بَصِیرٍ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ ع مَنْ أَدْمَنَ قِرَاءَهَ حم الزُّخْرُفِ آمَنَهُ اللَّهُ فِی قَبْرِهِ مِنْ هَوَامِّ الْأَرْضِ وَ ضَغْطَهِ الْقَبْرِ حَتَّی یَقِفَ بَیْنَ یَدَیِ اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ ثُمَّ جَاءَتْ حَتَّی تُدْخِلَهُ الْجَنَّهَ بِأَمْرِ اللَّهِ تَبَارَکَ وَ تَعَالَی.
hadees_english: 1. Imam Muhammad Baqir said, “One who regularly recites Surah Ha Mim Zukhruf, Allah will keep him safe in his grave from the crawling creatures and the squeeze of the grave till he comes before Allah, the Exalted and the Mighty. Then this Surah will come and get him admitted to Paradise by the order of Allah, the Blessed and the High.”

chapter: Chapter 206 | Reward of reciting Surah Dukhan
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ عَامِرٍ الْخَیَّاطِ عَنْ أَبِی حَمْزَهَ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ ع مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ الدُّخَانِ فِی فَرَائِضِهِ وَ نَوَافِلِهِ بَعَثَهُ اللَّهُ مَعَ الْآمِنِینَ یَوْمَ الْقِیَامَهِ وَ ظَلَّلَهُ تَحْتَ عَرْشِهِ وَ حَاسَبَهُ حِساباً یَسِیراً وَ أَعْطَاهُ کِتابَهُ بِیَمِینِهِ*
hadees_english: 1. Imam Muhammad Baqir said, “Whoever recites Surah Dukhan in his obligatory and recommended prayers, Allah would raise him on the Day of Judgment among those who would be in safety and peace and under the Throne of Allah, his accounting would be easy and his scroll of deeds would be given in his right hand.”

chapter: Chapter 207 | Reward of reciting Surah Jaathiya
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنْ عَاصِمٍ بن [عَنْ] أَبِی بَصِیرٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ الْجَاثِیَهِ کَانَ ثَوَابُهَا أَنْ لَا یَرَی النَّارَ أَبَداً وَ لَا یَسْمَعَ زَفِیرَ جَهَنَّمَ وَ لَا شَهِیقَهَا وَ هُوَ مَعَ مُحَمَّدٍ ص.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from ’Asim b. [from] Abi Basir from Abi Abdillah who said: Whoever recites Surah Jaathiya the benefit of it would be that he would never face Hell, and he would not be able to hear the painful screams and sighs, and that man would be in the company of the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.).

chapter: Chapter 208 | Reward of reciting Surah Ahqaaf
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ سَیْفِ بْنِ عَمِیرَهَ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ أَبِی یَعْفُورٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ کُلَّ لَیْلَهٍ أَوْ کُلَّ جُمُعَهٍ سُورَهَ الْأَحْقَافِ لَمْ یُصِبْهُ اللَّهُ بِرَوْعَهٍ فِی الْحَیَاهِ الدُّنْیَا وَ آمَنَهُ مِنْ فَزَعِ یَوْمِ الْقِیَامَهِ إِنْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan b. Sayf b. ’Umayra from Abdillah b. Abi Ya’fur from Abi Abdillah who said: One who recites Surah Ahqaaf every Friday eve or Friday, Allah would keep him away from the troubles in the worldly life, and on the Day of Judgment he would be safe from the painful screams, if Allah wills.

chapter: Chapter 209 | Reward of reciting Surahs starting with Ha Mim
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنْ أَبِی الْمِعْزَی عَنْ أَبِی بَصِیرٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: الْحَوَامِیمُ رَیَاحِینُ الْقُرْآنِ فَإِذَا قَرَأْتُمُوهَا فَاحْمَدُوا اللَّهَ وَ اشْکُرُوهُ کَثِیراً لِحِفْظِهِا وَ تِلَاوَتِهَا إِنَّ الْعَبْدَ لَیَقُومُ وَ لَیَقْرَأُ الْحَوَامِیمَ فَیَخْرُجُ مِنْ فِیهِ أَطْیَبُ مِنَ الْمِسْکِ الْأَذْفَرِ وَ الْعَنْبَرِ وَ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ لَیَرْحَمُ لِتَالِیهَا وَ قَارِیهَا وَ یَرْحَمُ جِیرَانَهُ وَ أَصْدِقَاءَهُ وَ مَعَارِفَهُ وَ کُلَّ حَمِیمٍ وَ قَرِیبٍ لَهُ وَ إِنَّهُ فِی الْقِیَامَهِ یَسْتَغْفِرُ لَهُ الْعَرْشُ وَ الْکُرْسِیُّ وَ مَلَائِکَهُ اللَّهِ الْمُقَرَّبُونَ.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from Abi al-Mi’za from Abi Basir from Abi Abdillah who said: “Surahs starting with Ha Mim are best fragrance of the Holy Quran. Praise and glorify Allah excessively whenever you recite them. Whenever a person recites them, his mouth smells far better than musk and amber. Allah showers His mercy on the reciter, his neighbors, friends, relatives and near and dear ones. The Divine throne, Kursi and nearest angels would repent for him on the Day of Judgment.”

chapter: Chapter 210 | Reward of reciting Surah Muhammad
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ أَبِی الْمِعْزَی عَنْ أَبِی بَصِیرٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ الَّذِینَ کَفَرُوا لَمْ یَرْتَبْ أَبَداً وَ لَمْ یَدْخُلْهُ شَکٌّ فِی دِینِهِ أَبَداً وَ لَمْ یَبْلُهُ اللَّهُ بِفَقْرٍ أَبَداً وَ لَا خَوْفٍ مِنْ سُلْطَانٍ أَبَداً وَ لَمْ یَزَلْ مَحْفُوظاً مِنَ الشَّکِّ وَ الْکُفْرِ أَبَداً حَتَّی یَمُوتَ فَإِذَا مَاتَ وَکَّلَ اللَّهُ بِهِ فِی قَبْرِهِ أَلْفَ مَلَکٍ یُصَلُّونَ فِی قَبْرِهِ وَ یَکُونُ ثَوَابُ صَلَاتِهِمْ لَهُ وَ یُشَیِّعُونَهُ حَتَّی یُوقِفُونَهُ مَوْقِفَ الْأَمْنِ عِنْدَ اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ وَ یَکُونُ فِی أَمَانِ اللَّهِ وَ أَمَانِ مُحَمَّدٍ ص.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from Abi al-Mi’za from Abi Basir from Abi Abdillah who said: One who recites it, doubt will never enter his religion, and protection from polytheism and disbelief will never leave him till he dies. Then when he dies, Allah appoints for him in his grave a thousand angels that pray in his grave, and the reward of their prayers will be for him, and they will remain with him till he is presented in a calm and quiet atmosphere before Allah, and he will be in the safety of Allah and safety of Muhammad (s.a.w.s.).

chapter: Chapter 211 | Reward of reciting Surah Fath
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ بُکَیْرٍ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: حَصِّنُوا أَمْوَالَکُمْ وَ نِسَاءَکُمْ وَ مَا مَلَکَتْ أَیْمَانُکُمْ مِنَ التَّلَفِ بِقِرَاءَهِ- إِنَّا فَتَحْنا لَکَ فَتْحاً مُبِیناً فَإِنَّهُ إِذَا کَانَ مِمَّنْ یُدْمِنُ قِرَاءَتَهَا نَادَی مُنَادٍ یَوْمَ الْقِیَامَهِ حَتَّی یُسْمِعَ الْخَلَائِقَ أَنْتَ مِنْ عِبَادِیَ الْمُخْلَصِینَ أَلْحِقُوهُ بِالصَّالِحِینَ مِنْ عِبَادِی وَ أَدْخِلُوهُ جَنَّاتِ النَّعِیمِ وَ اسْقُوهُ مِنَ الرَّحِیقِ الْمَخْتُومِ بِمِزَاجِ الْکَافُورِ.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from Abdillah b. Bukayr from his father from Abi Abdillah who said: “Protect your women and slave-girls through recitation of Surah Fath. For one who regularly recites this Surah a caller will call out on the Day of Judgment till all the creatures hear it: “You are from My righteous servants. Include him among My righteous servants and make him enter gardens of bliss (Paradise) and give him to drink the sealed drink laced with camphor.”

chapter: Chapter 212 | Reward of reciting Surah Hujurat
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحُسَیْنِ بْنِ أَبِی الْعَلَاءِ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ الْحُجُرَاتِ فِی کُلِّ لَیْلَهٍ أَوْ فِی کُلِّ یَوْمٍ کَانَ مِنْ زُوَّارِ مُحَمَّدٍ ص.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hussain b. Abi al-’Ala from Abi Abdillah who said: One who recites Surah Hujurat every night or everyday would be among those who visited Muhammad (s.a.w.s.).

chapter: Chapter 213 | Reward of reciting Surah Qaaf
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ أَبِی الْمِعْزَی عَنْ أَبِی حَمْزَهَ الثُّمَالِیِّ عَنْ أَبِی جَعْفَرٍ ع قَالَ: مَنْ أَدْمَنَ فِی فَرَائِضِهِ وَ نَوَافِلِهِ قِرَاءَهَ سُورَهِ ق وَسَّعَ اللَّهُ عَلَیْهِ فِی رِزْقِهِ وَ أَعْطَاهُ کِتابَهُ بِیَمِینِهِ* وَ حَاسَبَهُ حِساباً یَسِیراً
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from Abi al-Mi’za from Abi Hamzah al-Thumali from Abi Ja’far who said: Whoever has been reciting Surah Qaaf in his obligatory and supererogatory prayers Allah would grant addition and increase in his livelihood, his record of Deeds would be in his right hand and (on the Day of Judgment) his accounting would be in an easy and peaceful way.

chapter: Chapter 214 | Reward of reciting Surah Zariyat
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ صَنْدَلٍ عَنْ دَاوُدَ بْنِ فَرْقَدٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ وَ الذَّارِیَاتِ فِی یَوْمِهِ أَوْ فِی لَیْلَتِهِ أَصْلَحَ اللَّهُ لَهُ مَعِیشَتَهُ وَ أَتَاهُ بِرِزْقٍ وَاسِعٍ وَ نَوَّرَ لَهُ فِی قَبْرِهِ بِسِرَاجٍ یَزْهَرُ إِلَی یَوْمِ الْقِیَامَهِ.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from Sandal from Dawud b. Farqad from Abi Abdillah who said: One who keeps reciting Surah Zariyat in the day or night, Allah would improve the means of his livelihood and grant him much livelihood and also light up his grave with such a lamp that would keep burning and giving out light upto the Day of Judgment.

chapter: Chapter 215 | Reward of reciting Surah Tur
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ أَبِی أَیُّوبَ الْخَزَّازِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ وَ أَبِی جَعْفَرٍ ع قَالا مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ وَ الطُّورِ جَمَعَ اللَّهُ لَهُ خَیْرَ الدُّنْیَا وَ الْآخِرَهِ.
hadees_english: 1. It is narrated from Imam Ja’far Sadiq that Imam Muhammad Baqir said, “To one who recites Surah Tur Allah would grant goodness in this world and the hereafter.”

chapter: Chapter 216 | Reward of reciting Surah Najm
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ صَنْدَلٍ عَنْ یَزِیدَ بْنِ خَلِیفَهَ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ کَانَ یُدْمِنُ قِرَاءَهَ وَ النَّجْمِ فِی کُلِّ یَوْمٍ أَوْ فِی کُلِّ لَیْلَهٍ عَاشَ مَحْمُوداً بَیْنَ النَّاسِ وَ کَانَ مَوْفُوراً لَهُ وَ کَانَ مَحْبُوباً بَیْنَ النَّاسِ.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from Sandal from Yazid b. Khalifa from Abi Abdillah who said: Whoever regularly recites Surah Najm during the day or night would become praiseworthy and conspicuous among the people, would be forgiven (his sins) and would become popular and amiable among the people.

chapter: Chapter 217 | Reward of reciting Surah Rahman
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ أَبِی بَصِیرٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: لَا تَدَعُوا قِرَاءَهَ سُورَهِ الرَّحْمَنِ وَ الْقِیَامَ بِهَا فَإِنَّهَا لَا تَقِرُّ فِی قُلُوبِ الْمُنَافِقِینَ وَ یَأْتِی بِهَا رَبُّهَا یَوْمَ الْقِیَامَهِ فِی صُورَهِ آدَمِیٍّ فِی أَحْسَنِ صُورَهٍ وَ أَطْیَبِ رِیحٍ حَتَّی یَقِفَ مِنَ اللَّهِ مَوْقِفاً لَا یَکُونُ أَحَدٌ أَقْرَبَ إِلَی اللَّهِ مِنْهَا فَیَقُولُ لَهَا مَنِ الَّذِی کَانَ یَقُومُ بِکِ فِی الْحَیَاهِ الدُّنْیَا یُدْمِنُ قِرَاءَتَکِ فَتَقُولُ یَا رَبِّ فُلَانٌ وَ فُلَانٌ فَتَبْیَضُّ وُجُوهُهُمْ فَیَقُولُ لَهُمُ اشْفَعُوا فِیمَنْ أَحْبَبْتُمْ فَیَشْفَعُونَ حَتَّی لَا یَبْقَی لَهُمْ غَایَهٌ وَ لَا أَحَدٌ یَشْفَعُونَ لَهُ فَیَقُولُ لَهُمُ ادْخُلُوا الْجَنَّهَ وَ اسْکُنُوا فِیهَا حَیْثُ شِئْتُمْ.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from his father from Abi Basir from Abi Abdillah who said: “Recite Surah Rahman regularly and don’t miss its recitation because it does not have place in the heart of a hypocrite. It will be given a beautiful human face on the Day of Judgment and it would be nearest to Allah. It would be asked, ‘Who used to recite you regularly in the world’. It would respond with the names of the concerned persons. Then the faces of those persons would be brightened and they would be told, ‘Do intercession for whomsoever you want’. They would do intercession of innumerable people until there would remain no person whose intercession they wanted to do. Then those people will be ordered, ‘Enter Paradise and stay wherever you like’.”

hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی سَعْدُ بْنُ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ یَعْقُوبَ بْنِ یَزِیدَ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِی عُمَیْرٍ عَنْ هِشَامٍ أَوْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِنَا عَمَّنْ حَدَّثَهُ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ الرَّحْمَنِ فَقَالَ عِنْدَ کُلِ فَبِأَیِّ آلاءِ رَبِّکُما تُکَذِّبانِ لَا بِشَیْ ءٍ مِنْ آلَائِکَ رَبِّ أُکَذِّبُ فَإِنْ قَرَأَهَا لَیْلًا ثُمَّ مَاتَ مَاتَ شَهِیداً- وَ إِنْ قَرَأَهَا نَهَاراً ثُمَّ مَاتَ مَاتَ شَهِیداً.
hadees_english: 2. My father said: it was narrated to me by Sa’d b. Abdillah from Ya’qub b. Yazid from Ibn Abi ’Umayr from Hisham or some of our companions from the one the person that narrated to him from Abi Abdillah who said: “One who recites Surah Rahman should say Laa bi-shai-im min aalaa-ika rabbi ukadhdhib whenever he reaches Fa bi-ayyi aalaa-I rabbikumaa tukadhdhibaan. If a person recites it at night and dies he would be considered a martyr and if he recites it during day and dies then too he would be considered a martyr.”

chapter: Chapter 218 | Reward of reciting Surah Waqiya
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی أَحْمَدُ بْنُ إِدْرِیسَ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَحْمَدَ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ حَسَّانَ عَنْ إِسْمَاعِیلَ بْنِ مِهْرَانَ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِیٍّ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ أَبِی بَصِیرٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ فِی کُلِّ لَیْلَهِ جُمُعَهٍ الْوَاقِعَهَ أَحَبَّهُ اللَّهُ وَ أَحَبَّهُ إِلَی النَّاسِ أَجْمَعِینَ وَ لَمْ یَرَ فِی الدُّنْیَا بُؤْساً أَبَداً وَ لَا فَقْراً وَ لَا فَاقَهً وَ لَا آفَهً مِنْ آفَاتِ الدُّنْیَا وَ کَانَ مِنْ رُفَقَاءِ أَمِیرِ الْمُؤْمِنِینَ ع وَ هَذِهِ السُّورَهُ لِأَمِیرِ الْمُؤْمِنِینَ ع خَاصَّهً لَا یَشْرَکُهُ فِیهَا أَحَدٌ.
hadees_english: 1. My father said: it was narrated to me by Ahmad b. Idris who said it was narrated to me by Muhammad b. Ahmad who said it was narrated to me by Muhammad b. Ahmad from Ismail b. Mihran from al-Hassan b. Ali from his father from Abi Basir from Abi Abdillah who said: “One who recites Surah Waqiya every Friday eve, Allah would love him and create his love in the hearts of the people. He would keep that person away from misfortune, poverty, helplessness and calamities of the world. That person will be among the companions of Amirul Momineen . This Surah is completely related to Amirul Momineen only and no one else.”

hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ الصَّفَّارُ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ یَحْیَی قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مَعْرُوفٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ حَمْزَهَ قَالَ قَالَ الصَّادِقُ ع مَنِ اشْتَاقَ إِلَی الْجَنَّهِ وَ إِلَی صِفَتِهَا فَلْیَقْرَأِ الْوَاقِعَهَ وَ مَنْ أَحَبَّ أَنْ یَنْظُرَ إِلَی صِفَهِ النَّارِ فَلْیَقْرَأْ سَجْدَهَ لُقْمَانَ.
hadees_english: 2. Imam Ja’far Sadiq says, “One who wants to know about Paradise should recite Surah Waqiya and one who wants to know about Hell should recite Surah Luqman.”

hadees_arabic: حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ الصَّفَّارُ عَنِ الْعَبَّاسِ عَنْ حَمَّادٍ عَنْ عَمْرٍو عَنْ زَیْدٍ الشَّحَّامِ عَنْ أَبِی جَعْفَرٍ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ الْوَاقِعَهَ کُلَّ لَیْلَهٍ قَبْلَ أَنْ یَنَامَ لَقِیَ اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ وَ وَجْهُهُ کَالْقَمَرِ لَیْلَهَ الْبَدْرِ.
hadees_english: 3. It was narrated to me by Muhammad b. al-Hassan who said it was narrated to me by Muhammad b. al-Hassan al-Saffar from al-Abbas from Hamad from ’Amru from Zayd al-Shaham from Abi Ja’far who said: One who recites Waqiya every night before going to sleep would meet Allah while his face would be like the moon on a full moon night.

chapter: Chapter 219 | Reward of reciting Surah Hadid and Mujadila
hadees_arabic: أَبِی ره قَالَ حَدَّثَنِی أَحْمَدُ بْنُ إِدْرِیسَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ حَسَّانَ عَنْ إِسْمَاعِیلَ بْنِ مِهْرَانَ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنِ الْحُسَیْنِ بْنِ أَبِی الْعَلَاءِ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ الْحَدِیدِ وَ الْمُجَادَلَهِ فِی صَلَاهٍ فَرِیضَهٍ أَدْمَنَهَا لَمْ یُعَذِّبْهُ اللَّهُ حَتَّی یَمُوتَ أَبَداً وَ لَا یَرَی فِی نَفْسِهِ وَ لَا أَهْلِهِ سُوءاً أَبَداً وَ لَا خَصَاصَهً فِی بَدَنِهِ.
hadees_english: 1. My father said: it was narrated to me by Ahmad b. Idris from Muhammad b. Ahmad from Ismail b. Mihran from al-Hassan from al-Hussain b. Abi al-’Ala from Abi Abdillah who said: “One who recites Surah Hadid and Mujadila in obligatory prayers regularly, Allah will not involve him in chastisement till his death. He and his family will not face any difficulty and his body will remain proper and flawless.”

chapter: Chapter 220 | Reward of reciting Surah Hashr
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ عَلِیِّ بْنِ أَبِی الْقَاسِمِ الْکِنْدِیِّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْوَاحِدِ عَنْ أَبِی الْعَلِیِّ [الْخَلِیلِ] یَرْفَعُ الْحَدِیثَ عَنْ عَلِیِّ بْنِ زَیْدٍ عَنْ جُذْعَانَ عَنْ زِرِّ بْنِ حُبَیْشٍ عَنْ أُبَیِّ بْنِ کَعْبٍ عَنِ النَّبِیِّ ص قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ الْحَشْرِ لَمْ یَبْقَ جَنَّهٌ وَ لَا نَارٌ وَ لَا عَرْشٌ وَ لَا کُرْسِیٌّ وَ لَا الْحُجُبُ وَ السَّمَاوَاتُ السَّبْعُ وَ الْأَرَضُونَ السَّبْعُ وَ الْهَوَاءُ وَ الرِّیحُ وَ الطَّیْرُ وَ الشَّجَرُ وَ الْجِبَالُ وَ الشَّمْسُ وَ الْقَمَرُ وَ الْمَلَائِکَهُ إِلَّا صَلَّوْا عَلَیْهِ وَ اسْتَغْفَرُوا لَهُ وَ إِنْ مَاتَ فِی یَوْمِهِ أَوْ لَیْلَتِهِ مَاتَ شَهِیداً.
hadees_english: 1. The Messenger of Allah (s.a.w.s.) said: Whoever recites Surah Hashr none from among Paradise, Hell, Arsh (Allah’s Throne) Chair, Curtains, the seven Skies, the Seven earths, space, wind, birds, trees, mountains, Sun, Moon, and angels would miss seeking forgiveness for him and yearning for his safety. If that man dies that day or that night he would die a martyr.

chapter: Chapter 221 | Reward of reciting Surah Mumtahena
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ عَاصِمٍ الْخَیَّاطِ عَنْ أَبِی حَمْزَهَ الثُّمَالِیِّ عَنْ عَلِیِّ بْنِ الْحُسَیْنِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ الْمُمْتَحِنَهِ فِی فَرَائِضِهِ وَ نَوَافِلِهِ امْتَحَنَ اللَّهُ قَلْبَهُ لِلْإِیمَانِ وَ نَوَّرَ لَهُ بَصَرَهُ وَ لَا یُصِیبُهُ فَقْرٌ أَبَداً وَ لَا جُنُونٌ فِی بَدَنِهِ وَ لَا فِی وُلْدِهِ.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from ’Asim al-Khayyat from Abi Hamzah al-Thumali from Ali b. al-Hussain who said: “One who recites Surah Mumtahena in his obligatory and recommended prayer, Allah examines his heart for belief, and brightens his sight and he is never ever afflicted with poverty, insanity in himself or his children.”

chapter: Chapter 222 | Reward of reciting Surah Saff
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ أَبِی بَصِیرٍ عَنْ أَبِی جَعْفَرٍ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ الصَّفِّ وَ أَدْمَنَ قِرَاءَتَهَا فِی فَرَائِضِهِ وَ نَوَافِلِهِ صَفَّهُ اللَّهُ مَعَ مَلَائِکَتِهِ وَ أَنْبِیَائِهِ الْمُرْسَلِینَ إِنْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from his father from Abi Basir from Abi Ja’far who said: One who recites Surah Saff and is regular in reciting it in the obligatory prayers, Allah includes him in the row of His angels, prophets and messengers, Insha Allah.

chapter: Chapter 223 | Reward of reciting Surah Juma, Munafiqun and Aala
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ سَیْفِ بْنِ عَمِیرَهَ عَنْ مَنْصُورِ بْنِ حَازِمٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: الْوَاجِبُ عَلَی کُلِّ مُؤْمِنٍ إِذَا کَانَ لَنَا شِیعَهً أَنْ یَقْرَأَ فِی لَیْلَهِ الْجُمُعَهِ بِالْجُمُعَهِ وَ سَبِّحِ اسْمَ رَبِّکَ الْأَعْلَی وَ فِی صَلَاهِ الظُّهْرِ بِالْجُمُعَهِ وَ الْمُنَافِقِینَ فَإِذَا فَعَلَ ذَلِکَ فَکَأَنَّمَا یَعْمَلُ کَعَمَلِ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ ص وَ کَانَ جَزَاؤُهُ وَ ثَوَابُهُ عَلَی اللَّهِ الْجَنَّهَ.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from Sayf b. ’Umayra from Mansur b. Hazim from Abi Abdillah who said: “It is obligatory on every believer who is our Shia to recite Surah Juma and Surah Aala every Friday eve, and recite Surah Juma and Munafiqun in Friday noon prayer. A person doing so is like a person who is performing the deed of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. The reward of this deed is that Allah would grant him Paradise.”

chapter: Chapter 224 | Reward of reciting Surah Taghabun
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنِ الْحُسَیْنِ بْنِ أَبِی الْعَلَاءِ عَنْ أَبِی بَصِیرٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ التَّغَابُنِ فِی فَرِیضَهٍ کَانَتْ شَفِیعَهً لَهُ یَوْمَ الْقِیَامَهِ وَ شَاهِدَ عَدْلٍ عِنْدَ مَنْ یُجِیزُ شَهَادَتَهَا ثُمَّ لَا یُفَارِقُهَا حَتَّی یَدْخُلَ الْجَنَّهَ.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from al-Hussain b. Abi al-’Ala from Abi Basir from Abi Abdillah who said: One who recites Surah Taghabun in his obligatory prayers it will intercede for him on the Day of Judgment, offer evidence for him in justice, near one who considers its testimony justified for himself, it would not separate from him till it has him admitted in Paradise.

chapter: Chapter 224 | Reward of reciting Surah Taghabun
hadees_arabic: وَ بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِیٍّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مِسْکِینٍ عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ بَکْرٍ عَنْ جَابِرٍ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ ع یَقُولُ مَنْ قَرَأَ بِالْمُسَبَّحَاتِ کُلِّهَا قَبْلَ أَنْ یَنَامَ لَمْ یَمُتْ حَتَّی یُدْرِکَ الْقَائِمَ ع وَ إِنْ مَاتَ کَانَ فِی جِوَارِ النَّبِیِّ ص.
hadees_english: 2. Imam Muhammad Baqir said, “One who recites all the recommendations before going to bed will not die until he sees Qaim-e-Aale Muhammad (s.a.w.s.) and if he dies he will get place in the neighborhood of the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.).”

chapter: Chapter 225 | Reward of reciting Surah Talaq and Tahrim
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِیٍّ عَنِ الْحُسَیْنِ بْنِ أَبِی الْعَلَاءِ عَنْ أَبِی بَصِیرٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ الطَّلَاقِ وَ التَّحْرِیمِ فِی فَرِیضَهٍ أَعَاذَهُ اللَّهُ مِنْ أَنْ یَکُونَ یَوْمَ الْقِیَامَهِ مِمَّنْ یَخَافُ أَوْ یَحْزَنُ وَ عُوفِیَ مِنَ النَّارِ وَ أَدْخَلَهُ اللَّهُ الْجَنَّهَ بِتِلَاوَتِهِ إِیَّاهُمَا وَ مُحَافَظَتِهِ عَلَیْهِمَا لِأَنَّهُمَا لِلنَّبِیِّ ص.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan b. Ali from al-Hussain b. Abi al-’Ala from Abi Basir from Abi Abdillah who said: “One who recites Surah Talaq and Tahrim in his obligatory prayers the Almighty Allah would protect him from the fear of the Day of Judgment and save him from Hell. He would enter Paradise due to recitation of these Surahs for they are related to the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.).”

chapter: Chapter 226 | Reward of reciting Surah Mulk
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ أَبِی بَصِیرٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ تَبارَکَ الَّذِی بِیَدِهِ الْمُلْکُ فِی الْمَکْتُوبَهِ قَبْلَ أَنْ یَنَامَ لَمْ یَزَلْ فِی أَمَانِ اللَّهِ حَتَّی یُصْبِحَ وَ فِی أَمَانِهِ یَوْمَ الْقِیَامَهِ حَتَّی یَدْخُلَ الْجَنَّهَ.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from his father from Abi Basir from Abi Abdillah who said: “One who recites Surah Mulk before going to bed or in his obligatory prayers would remain safe till morning. Also he would remain in Allah’s protection till he enters Paradise.”

chapter: Chapter 227 | Reward of reciting Surah Qalam
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِیِّ بْنِ مَیْمُونٍ الصَّائِغِ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ ن وَ الْقَلَمِ فِی فَرِیضَهٍ أَوْ نَافِلَهٍ آمَنَهُ اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ مِنْ أَنْ یُصِیبَهُ فَقْرٌ أَبَداً وَ أَعَاذَهُ اللَّهُ إِذَا مَاتَ مِنْ ضَمَّهِ الْقَبْرِ.
hadees_english: 1. Imam as-Sadiq says: Whoever recites Surah “Noon wal Qalam” in his obligatory or recommended prayers, Allah would always keep him safe and protected from destitution and poverty, and when that man dies, Allah would grant him exemption from the squeeze of the grave.

chapter: Chapter 228 | Reward of reciting Surah Haqqah
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مِسْکِینٍ عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ شِمْرٍ عَنْ جَابِرٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: أَکْثِرُوا مِنْ قِرَاءَهِ الْحَاقَّهِ فَإِنَّ قِرَاءَتَهَا فِی الْفَرَائِضِ وَ النَّوَافِلِ مِنَ الْإِیمَانِ بِاللَّهِ وَ رَسُولِهِ لِأَنَّهَا إِنَّمَا نَزَلَتْ فِی أَمِیرِ الْمُؤْمِنِینَ ع وَ مُعَاوِیَهَ وَ لَمْ یُسْلَبْ قَارِیهَا دِینَهُ حَتَّی یَلْقَی اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from Muhammad b. Miskeen from ’Amru b. Shimr from Jabir from Abi Abdillah who said: Recite Surah Haqqah very often because recitation of Surah Haqqah in obligatory and recommended prayers is a sign of belief in Allah and His Prophet. It is related to Amirul Momineen and Muawiyah and the religion of the reciter would not remain doubtful and uncertain till he meets Allah.

hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مِسْکِینٍ عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ شِمْرٍ عَنْ جَابِرٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: أَکْثِرُوا مِنْ قِرَاءَهِ سَأَلَ سَائِلٌ فَإِنَّ مَنْ أَکْثَرَ قِرَاءَتَهَا لَمْ یَسْأَلْهُ اللَّهُ تَعَالَی یَوْمَ الْقِیَامَهِ عَنْ ذَنْبٍ عَمِلَهُ وَ أَسْکَنَهُ الْجَنَّهَ مَعَ مُحَمَّدٍ ص إِنْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from Muhammad b. Miskeen from ’Amru b. Shimr from Jabir from Abi Abdillah who said: You people should recite “Sa’ala Saa-elun” (Surah Ma’arij) very much, because whoever recites Surah Ma’arij very much Allah would not count his mistakes on the Day of Judgment, and that man would be in Paradise with the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.), if Allah wills.

chapter: Chapter 230 | Reward of reciting Surah Nuh
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنِ الْحُسَیْنِ بْنِ هَاشِمٍ عَنْ أَبِیهِ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ کَانَ یُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَ یَقْرَأُ کِتَابَهُ لَا یَدَعُ قِرَاءَهَ سُورَهِ إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنا نُوحاً إِلی قَوْمِهِ فَأَیُّ عَبْدٍ قَرَأَهَا مُحْتَسِباً صَابِراً فِی فَرِیضَهٍ أَوْ نَافِلَهٍ أَسْکَنَهُ اللَّهُ تَعَالَی مَسَاکِنَ الْأَبْرَارِ وَ أَعْطَاهُ ثَلَاثَ جِنَانٍ مَعَ جَنَّتِهِ کَرَامَهً مِنَ اللَّهِ وَ زَوَّجَهُ مِائَتَیْ حَوْرَاءَ وَ أَرْبَعَهَ آلَافِ ثَیِّبٍ إِنْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from al-Hussain b. Hashim from his father from Abi Abdillah who said: Whoever has belief and firm conviction on Allah should not miss recitation of “Inna Arsalna Noohan ilaa Qaumeh” (i.e. Surah Nuh) because whoever recites Surah Nuh in his obligatory and recommended prayer, Allah would allow him to stay with the virtuous and approved persons of Allah and would award him three gardens of Paradise with his garden by His special favors. He would marry the reciter to two hundred Hoorul Ein and four thousand other women.

chapter: Chapter 231 | Reward of reciting Surah Jinn
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنْ حَنَانِ بْنِ سَدِیرٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ أَکْثَرَ قِرَاءَهَ قُلْ أُوحِیَ إِلَیَ لَمْ یُصِبْهُ فِی الْحَیَاهِ الدُّنْیَا شَیْ ءٌ مِنْ أَعْیُنِ الْجِنِّ وَ لَا نَفْثِهِمْ وَ لَا سِحْرِهِمْ وَ لَا مِنْ کَیْدِهِمْ وَ کَانَ مَعَ مُحَمَّدٍ ص فَیَقُولُ یَا رَبِّ لَا أُرِیدُ بِهِ بَدَلًا وَ لَا أُرِیدُ أَنْ أَبْغِیَ عَنْهُ حِوَلًا.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from Hanan b. Sadeer from Abi Abdillah who said: Whoever recites it often would neither be affected by the evil eye of Jinn in his worldly life, nor can there be any effect on him of sorcery, now can any harm occur to him through any kind of machination or Satanic action of the Jinn. Also the reciter of Surah Jinn would be in the company of the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.) and his Progeny .

chapter: Chapter 232 | Reward of reciting Surah Muzzammil
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ سَیْفِ بْنِ عَمِیرَهَ عَنْ مَنْصُورِ بْنِ جَابِرٍ عَنْ أَبِی عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ سُورَهَ الْمُزَّمِّلِ فِی الْعِشَاءِ الْآخِرَهِ أَوْ فِی آخِرِ اللَّیْلِ کَانَ لَهُ اللَّیْلُ وَ النَّهَارُ شَاهِدَیْنِ مَعَ سُورَهِ الْمُزَّمِّلِ وَ أَحْیَاهُ اللَّهُ حَیَاهً طَیِّبَهً وَ أَمَاتَهُ مِیتَهً طَیِّبَهً.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from Sayf b. ’Umayra from Mansur b. Jabir from Abi Abdillah who said: “One who recites Surah Muzzammil in Isha prayer or during last part of night, the night and the day will bear witness along with Surah Muzzammil for him and the Almighty Allah will grant him pure life and death.”

chapter: Chapter 233 | Reward of reciting Surah Muddassir
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ عَاصِمٍ الْخَیَّاطِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِی جَعْفَرٍ مُحَمَّدٍ الْبَاقِرِ ع قَالَ: مَنْ قَرَأَ فِی الْفَرِیضَهِ سُورَهَ الْمُدَّثِّرِ کَانَ حَقّاً عَلَی اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ أَنْ یَجْعَلَهُ مَعَ مُحَمَّدٍ ص فِی دَرَجَتِهِ وَ لَا یُدْرِکُهُ فِی حَیَاهِ الدُّنْیَا شَقَاءٌ أَبَداً إِنْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from ’Asim al-Khayyat from Muhammad b. Muslim from Abi Ja’far Muhammad al-Baqir who said: Imam Muhammad Baqir , “One who recites Surah Muddassir in his obligatory Salaat it is the duty of Allah to give him a status along with Muhammad (s.a.w.s.) and he will not face any difficulty in his worldly life, God-Willing.”

chapter: Chapter 234 | Reward of reciting Surah Qiyamat
hadees_arabic: بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنِ الْحُسَیْنِ بْنِ أَبِی الْعَلَاءِ عَنْ أَبِی بَصِیرٍ عَنْ أَبِی جَعْفَرٍ ع قَالَ: مَنْ أَدْمَنَ قِرَاءَهَ لا أُقْسِمُ وَ کَانَ یَعْمَلُ بِهَا بَعَثَهُ اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ مَعَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ ص مِنْ قَبْرِهِ فِی أَحْسَنِ صُورَهٍ وَ یُبَشِّرُهُ وَ یَضْحَکُ فِی وَجْهِهِ حَتَّی یَجُوزَ عَلَی الصِّرَاطِ وَ الْمِیزَانِ.
hadees_english: 1. From the previous chain from al-Hassan from al-Hussain b. Abi al-’Ala from Abi Basir from Abi Ja’far who said: Whoever recites Surah Qiyamat regularly and acts upon it, Allah would raise him from the grave with the Messenger of Allah (s.a.w.s.) in the best form. He would be given glad-tiding and he would pass through Sirat and Mizan smiling.
